methods.description: Sets the name of the forward that is looked up upon completion.

methods.name: getInputFromFixedValue
methods.description: If set, this fixed value is taken as input, instead of regular input

methods.name: getInputFromSessionKey
methods.description: If set, input is taken from this session key, instead of regular input

methods.name: hideMethod
methods.description: (only used when hideregex is not empty and only applies to error/logstore) either all or firsthalf. when firsthalf only the first half of the string is masked, otherwise (all) the entire string is masked

methods.name: hideRegex
methods.description: next to common usage in {@link AbstractPipe}, also strings in the error/logstore are masked

methods.name: ifParam
methods.description: when set, this pipe is only executed when the value of parameter with name ifparam equals ifvalue (otherwise this pipe is skipped)

methods.name: ifValue
methods.description: see ifparam

methods.name: ignoreExceptions
methods.description: When true ignore any exception thrown by executing sender

methods.name: itemNoSessionKey
methods.description: Key of session variable to store number of items processed, i.e. the position or index in the set of items to be processed.

methods.name: labelNamespaceDefs
methods.description: namespace defintions for labelxpath. must be in the form of a comma or space separated list of prefix=namespaceuri-definitions

methods.name: labelStyleSheet
methods.description: stylesheet to extract label from message

methods.name: labelXPath
methods.description: xpath expression to extract label from message

methods.name: linkMethod
methods.description: either MESSAGEID or CORRELATIONID. For asynchronous communication, the server side may either use the messageID or the correlationID in the correlationID field of the reply message. Use this property to set the behaviour of the reply-listener.

methods.name: lockRows
methods.description: When set true, exclusive row-level locks are obtained on all the rows identified by the select statement (e.g. by appending ' FOR UPDATE NOWAIT SKIP LOCKED' to the end of the query)

methods.name: lockWait
methods.description: when set and >=0, ' FOR UPDATE WAIT #' is used instead of ' FOR UPDATE NOWAIT SKIP LOCKED'

methods.name: maxChildThreads
methods.description: maximum number of child threads that may run in parallel simultaneously (combined total of all threads calling this pipe)

methods.name: maxItems
methods.description: The maximum number of items returned. The (default) value of 0 means unlimited, all available items will be returned

methods.name: maxRetries
methods.description: the number of times a processing attempt is retried after a timeout or an exception is caught or after a incorrect reply is received (see also retryxpath)

methods.name: maxThreads
methods.description: maximum number of threads that may call {@link #doPipe(java.lang.Object, nl.nn.adapterframework.core.IPipeLineSession)} simultaneously

methods.name: name
methods.description: name of the pipe

methods.name: namespaceAware
methods.description: controls namespace-awareness of possible xml parsing in descender-classes

methods.name: namespaceDefs
methods.description: Namespace defintions for xpathExpression. Must be in the form of a comma or space separated list of prefix=namespaceuri-definitions. For some use other cases (NOT xpathExpression), one entry can be without a prefix, that will define the default namespace.

methods.name: omitXmlDeclaration
methods.description: Force the transformer generated from the xpath-expression to omit the xml declaration

methods.name: outputType
methods.description: Either 'text' or 'xml'. only valid for xpathexpression

methods.name: parallel
methods.description: When set true, the calls for all items are done in parallel (a new thread is started for each call). when collectresults set true, this pipe will wait for all calls to finish before results are collected and pipe result is returned

methods.name: preserveInput
methods.description: If set true, the result of the pipe is replaced with the original input (i.e. the input before configured replacements of getInputFromSessionKey, getInputFromFixedValue or emptyInputReplacement)

methods.name: presumedTimeOutInterval
methods.description: when the previous call was a timeout, the maximum time (in seconds) after this timeout to presume the current call is also a timeout. a value of -1 indicates to never presume timeouts

methods.name: query
methods.description: The SQL query text to be excecuted each time sendMessage() is called. When not set, the input message is taken as the query

methods.name: removeDuplicates
methods.description: When true duplicate input elements are removed, i.e. they are handled only once

methods.name: removeXmlDeclarationInResults
methods.description: Postprocess each partial result, to remove the xml-declaration, as this is not allowed inside an xml-document

methods.defaultValue: If set true, compacted messages in the result are restored to their original format (see also {@link #setElementToMove(java.lang.String)})
methods.name: restoreMovedElements
resultOnTimeOut
methods.description: result returned when no return-message was received within the timeout limit (e.g. 'receiver timed out').

methods.name: retryMaxInterval
methods.description: the maximum number of seconds waited after an unsuccessful processing attempt before another processing attempt is made

methods.name: retryMinInterval
methods.description: the starting number of seconds waited after an unsuccessful processing attempt before another processing attempt is made. each next retry this interval is doubled with a upper limit of retrymaxinterval

methods.name: retryNamespaceDefs
methods.description: namespace defintions for retryxpath. must be in the form of a comma or space separated list of prefix=namespaceuri-definitions

methods.name: retryXPath
methods.description: xpath expression evaluated on each technical successful reply. retry is done if condition returns true

methods.defaultValue: (Only used when writetoseclog=true) Comma separated list of keys of session variables that is appended to the security log record
methods.name: secLogSessionKeys
skipOnEmptyInput
methods.description: when set, the processing continues directly at the forward of this pipe, without executing the pipe itself

methods.name: sqlDialect
methods.description: If set, the SQL dialect in which the queries are written and should be translated from to the actual SQL dialect

methods.name: stopConditionXPathExpression
methods.description: Expression evaluated on each result if set. Iteration stops if condition returns anything other than an empty result. To test for the root element to have an attribute 'finished' with the value 'yes', the expression *[@finished='yes'] can be used. This can be used if the condition to stop can be derived from the item result. To stop after a maximum number of items has been processed, use maxItems.Previous versions documented that position()=2 could be used. This is not working as expected; Use maxItems instead

methods.name: storeResultInSessionKey
methods.description: If set, the result (before replacing when true) is stored under this session key

methods.name: streamResultToServlet
methods.description: if set, the result is first base64 decoded and then streamed to the httpservletresponse object

methods.name: streamingActive
methods.description: If true, then this pipe can provide an OutputStream to the previous pipe, to write its output to. Can be used to switch this streaming off for debugging purposes

methods.name: stubFileName
methods.description: when set, the pipe returns a message from a file, instead of doing the regular process

methods.name: styleSheetName
methods.description: Stylesheet to apply to each message, before sending it

methods.name: timeOutOnResult
methods.description: when not empty, a timeoutexception is thrown when the result equals this value (for testing purposes only)

methods.description: for action=append: when set to a positive number, the file is rotated each day, and this number of files is kept. The inputFolder must point to the directory where the file resides

methods.name: rotateSize
methods.description: for action=append: when set to a positive number, the file is rotated when it has reached the specified size, and the number of files specified in numberOfBackups is kept. Size is specified in plain bytes, suffixes like 'K', 'M' or 'G' are not recognized. The inputFolder must point to the directory where the file resides

methods.defaultValue: (Only used when writetoseclog=true) Comma separated list of keys of session variables that is appended to the security log record

share

methods.description: If set, the result (before replacing when true) is stored under this session key

methods.description: Possible values: list, info, read, readDelete, move, copy, delete, mkdir, rmdir, write, append, rename

methods.name: active
methods.description: controls whether pipe is included in configuration. when set false or set to something else as true, (even set to the empty string), the pipe is not included in the configuration

methods.name: authAlias
methods.description: alias used to obtain credentials for the smb share

methods.name: authType
methods.description: Type of the authentication either 'NTLM' or 'SPNEGO'

methods.name: base64
methods.description: Can be set to 'encode' or 'decode' for actions read, write and append. When set the stream is base64 encoded or decoded, respectively

methods.name: chompCharSize
methods.description: If set (>=0) and the character data length inside a xml element exceeds this size, the character data is chomped (with a clear comment)

methods.description: when set to true, the folder to move to is created if it does not exist

methods.name: destination
methods.description: destination for move, copy or rename. If not set, the parameter destination is used. When that is not set either, the input is used

methods.defaultValue: If durationThreshold >=0 and the duration of the message processing exceeded the value specified (in milliseconds) the message is logged informatory

methods.defaultValue: ref_ + the name of the element

methods.description: (Only used when elementToMove is set) Name of the session key under which the character data is stored

methods.description: If set and the input is empty, this fixed value is taken as input

methods.description: If set, this fixed value is taken as input, instead of regular input

methods.name: getInputFromSessionKey
methods.description: If set, input is taken from this session key, instead of regular input

methods.description: Regular expression to mask strings in the log. methods.description: Kerberos Realm, as set in java.security.krb5.realm. If authentication type specified as SPNEGO this field must be filled. If not filled then default realm is used

methods.description: stylesheet to extract correlationid from message

methods.description: xpath expression to extract correlationid from message

methods.defaultValue: 0 (one line at a time, no prefix of suffix)
methods.name: blockSize
methods.description: Controls multiline behaviour. If set to a value greater than 0, it specifies the number of rows send in a block to the sender.

methods.name: blockSuffix
methods.description: If combineBlocks = true, this string is inserted at the end of the set of lines. Requires blockSize or startPosition and endPosition to be set too.

methods.description: when set, besides the xml well-formedness the root element of the result is checked to be equal to the value set

methods.description: when set to false, the inputstream is not closed after it has been used

methods.description: Controls whether all the results of each iteration will be collected in one result message. If set false, only a small summary is returned. Setting this attributes to false is often required to enable processing of very large files. N.B. Remember in such a case that setting transactionAttribute to NotSupported might be necessary too

methods.name: combineBlocks
methods.description: If true, all items in a block are sent at once. If set false, items are sent individually, potentially leveraging block enabled sending capabilities of the sender

methods.description: namespace defintions for correlationidxpath. must be in the form of a comma or space separated list of prefix=namespaceuri-definitions

methods.description: key of a pipelinesession-variable. is specified, the value of the pipelinesession variable is used as input for the xpathexpression or stylesheet, instead of the current input message

methods.name: correlationIDStyleSheet
methods.description: stylesheet to extract correlationid from message

methods.name: correlationIDXPath
methods.description: xpath expression to extract correlationid from message

methods.defaultValue: If durationThreshold >=0 and the duration of the message processing exceeded the value specified (in milliseconds) the message is logged informatory
methods.name: durationThreshold
elementToMove
methods.description: If set, the character data in this element is stored under a session key and in the message replaced by a reference to this session key: {sessionkey: + elementToMoveSessionKey + }

methods.name: elementToMoveChain
methods.description: Like elementToMove but element is preceded with all ancestor elements and separated by semicolons (e.g. 'adapter;pipeline;pipe')

methods.defaultValue: ref_ + the name of the element
methods.name: elementToMoveSessionKey
methods.description: (Only used when elementToMove is set) Name of the session key under which the character data is stored

methods.name: emptyInputReplacement
methods.description: If set and the input is empty, this fixed value is taken as input

methods.name: endOfLineString
methods.description: when set, each line has to end with this string. if the line doesn't end with this string next lines are added (including line separators) until the total line ends with the given string

methods.name: endPosition
methods.description: If endPosition >= startPosition, this field contains the end position of the key in the current record

methods.name: escapeXml
methods.description: Escape XML characters in each item

methods.name: exceptionOnResult
methods.description: when not empty, a piperunexception is thrown when the result equals this value (for testing purposes only)

methods.name: forwardName
methods.description: Sets the name of the forward that is looked up upon completion.

methods.name: getInputFromFixedValue
methods.description: If set, this fixed value is taken as input, instead of regular input

methods.name: getInputFromSessionKey
methods.description: If set, input is taken from this session key, instead of regular input

methods.name: hideMethod
methods.description: (only used when hideregex is not empty and only applies to error/logstore) either all or firsthalf. when firsthalf only the first half of the string is masked, otherwise (all) the entire string is masked

methods.name: hideRegex
methods.description: next to common usage in {@link AbstractPipe}, also strings in the error/logstore are masked

methods.name: ifParam
methods.description: when set, this pipe is only executed when the value of parameter with name ifparam equals ifvalue (otherwise this pipe is skipped)

methods.name: ifValue
methods.description: see ifparam

methods.name: ignoreExceptions
methods.description: When true ignore any exception thrown by executing sender

methods.name: itemNoSessionKey
methods.description: Key of session variable to store number of items processed, i.e. the position or index in the set of items to be processed.

methods.name: labelNamespaceDefs
methods.description: namespace defintions for labelxpath. must be in the form of a comma or space separated list of prefix=namespaceuri-definitions

methods.name: labelStyleSheet
methods.description: stylesheet to extract label from message

methods.name: labelXPath
methods.description: xpath expression to extract label from message

methods.name: linePrefix
methods.description: This string is inserted at the start of each item

methods.name: lineSuffix
methods.description: This string is appended at the end of each item

methods.name: linkMethod
methods.description: either MESSAGEID or CORRELATIONID. For asynchronous communication, the server side may either use the messageID or the correlationID in the correlationID field of the reply message. Use this property to set the behaviour of the reply-listener.

methods.name: maxChildThreads
methods.description: maximum number of child threads that may run in parallel simultaneously (combined total of all threads calling this pipe)

methods.name: maxItems
methods.description: The maximum number of items returned. The (default) value of 0 means unlimited, all available items will be returned

methods.name: maxRetries
methods.description: the number of times a processing attempt is retried after a timeout or an exception is caught or after a incorrect reply is received (see also retryxpath)

methods.name: maxThreads
methods.description: maximum number of threads that may call {@link #doPipe(java.lang.Object, nl.nn.adapterframework.core.IPipeLineSession)} simultaneously

methods.name: name
methods.description: name of the pipe

methods.name: namespaceAware
methods.description: controls namespace-awareness of possible xml parsing in descender-classes

methods.name: namespaceDefs
methods.description: Namespace defintions for xpathExpression. Must be in the form of a comma or space separated list of prefix=namespaceuri-definitions. For some use other cases (NOT xpathExpression), one entry can be without a prefix, that will define the default namespace.

methods.name: omitXmlDeclaration
methods.description: Force the transformer generated from the xpath-expression to omit the xml declaration

methods.name: outputType
methods.description: Either 'text' or 'xml'. only valid for xpathexpression

methods.name: parallel
methods.description: When set true, the calls for all items are done in parallel (a new thread is started for each call). when collectresults set true, this pipe will wait for all calls to finish before results are collected and pipe result is returned

methods.name: preserveInput
methods.description: If set true, the result of the pipe is replaced with the original input (i.e. the input before configured replacements of getInputFromSessionKey, getInputFromFixedValue or emptyInputReplacement)

methods.name: presumedTimeOutInterval
methods.description: when the previous call was a timeout, the maximum time (in seconds) after this timeout to presume the current call is also a timeout. a value of -1 indicates to never presume timeouts

methods.name: removeDuplicates
methods.description: When true duplicate input elements are removed, i.e. they are handled only once

methods.name: removeXmlDeclarationInResults
methods.description: Postprocess each partial result, to remove the xml-declaration, as this is not allowed inside an xml-document

methods.defaultValue: If set true, compacted messages in the result are restored to their original format (see also {@link #setElementToMove(java.lang.String)})
methods.name: restoreMovedElements
resultOnTimeOut
methods.description: result returned when no return-message was received within the timeout limit (e.g. 'receiver timed out').

methods.name: retryMaxInterval
methods.description: the maximum number of seconds waited after an unsuccessful processing attempt before another processing attempt is made

methods.name: retryMinInterval
methods.description: the starting number of seconds waited after an unsuccessful processing attempt before another processing attempt is made. each next retry this interval is doubled with a upper limit of retrymaxinterval

methods.name: retryNamespaceDefs
methods.description: namespace defintions for retryxpath. must be in the form of a comma or space separated list of prefix=namespaceuri-definitions

methods.name: retryXPath
methods.description: xpath expression evaluated on each technical successful reply. retry is done if condition returns true

methods.defaultValue: (Only used when writetoseclog=true) Comma separated list of keys of session variables that is appended to the security log record
methods.name: secLogSessionKeys
skipOnEmptyInput
methods.description: when set, the processing continues directly at the forward of this pipe, without executing the pipe itself

methods.name: startPosition
methods.description: If startPosition >= 0, this field contains the start position of the key in the current record (first character is 0); A sequence of lines with the same key is put in one block and send to the sender. Cannot be used in combination with blockSize.

methods.name: stopConditionXPathExpression
methods.description: Expression evaluated on each result if set. Iteration stops if condition returns anything other than an empty result. To test for the root element to have an attribute 'finished' with the value 'yes', the expression *[@finished='yes'] can be used. This can be used if the condition to stop can be derived from the item result. To stop after a maximum number of items has been processed, use maxItems.Previous versions documented that position()=2 could be used. This is not working as expected; Use maxItems instead

methods.name: storeResultInSessionKey
methods.description: If set, the result (before replacing when true) is stored under this session key

methods.name: streamResultToServlet
methods.description: if set, the result is first base64 decoded and then streamed to the httpservletresponse object

methods.name: streamingActive
methods.description: If true, then this pipe can provide an OutputStream to the previous pipe, to write its output to. Can be used to switch this streaming off for debugging purposes

methods.name: stubFileName
methods.description: when set, the pipe returns a message from a file, instead of doing the regular process

methods.name: styleSheetName
methods.description: Stylesheet to apply to each message, before sending it

methods.name: timeOutOnResult
methods.description: when not empty, a timeoutexception is thrown when the result equals this value (for testing purposes only)

methods.name: transactionAttribute
methods.description:
Defines transaction and isolation behaviour.For developers: it is equalto EJB transaction attribute.Possible values are:
transactionAttributecallers TransactionPipeline excecuted in Transaction
Required noneT2
T1 T1
RequiresNew noneT2
T1 T2
Mandatory noneerror
T1 T1
NotSupportednonenone
T1 none
Supports nonenone
T1 T1
Never nonenone
T1 error

methods.name: transactionAttributeNum
methods.description:
Like transactionAttribute, but the chosen option is represented with a number. The numbers mean:
0Required
1Supports
2Mandatory
3RequiresNew
4NotSupported
5Never

methods.name: transactionTimeout
methods.description: timeout (in seconds) of transaction started to process a message.

methods.name: useInputForExtract
methods.description: when set true, the input of a pipe is used to extract audit trail, correlationid and label (instead of the wrapped input)

methods.name: xpathExpression
methods.description: Alternatively: xpath-expression to create stylesheet from

methods.name: active
methods.description: controls whether pipe is included in configuration. when set false or set to something else as true, (even set to the empty string), the pipe is not included in the configuration

methods.name: antiVirusFailureAsSoapFault
methods.description: (only used for parameter httprequest and when checkantivirus=true) when true and the antivirusfailed forward is specified and the antivirus scan did not pass, a soap fault is returned instead of only a plain error message

methods.name: antiVirusFailureReasonSessionKey
methods.description: (only used for parameter httprequest and when checkantivirus=true) if not empty and the antivirusfailed forward is specified and the antivirus scan did not pass, the error message (or soap fault) is stored in this session key and the first string part is returned to the pipeline

methods.name: antiVirusMessagePartName
methods.description: (only used for parameter httprequest and when checkantivirus=true) name of antivirus scan message parts

methods.name: antiVirusPartName
methods.description: (only used for parameter httprequest and when checkantivirus=true) name of antivirus scan status parts

methods.name: antiVirusPassedMessage
methods.description: (only used for parameter httprequest and when checkantivirus=true) message of antivirus scan parts which indicates the antivirus scan passed

methods.name: checkAntiVirus
methods.description: (only used for parameter httprequest) when true parts are checked for antivirus scan returncode. these antivirus scan parts have been added by another application (so the antivirus scan is not performed in this pipe). for each file part an antivirus scan part have been added by this other application (directly after this file part)

methods.name: chompCharSize

methods.defaultValue: 0 (one line at a time, no prefix of suffix)
methods.name: blockSize
methods.description: Controls multiline behaviour. If set to a value greater than 0, it specifies the number of rows send in a block to the sender.

methods.name: blockSuffix
methods.description: If combineBlocks = true, this string is inserted at the end of the set of lines. Requires blockSize or startPosition and endPosition to be set too.

methods.name: checkRootTag
methods.description: when set, besides the xml well-formedness the root element of the result is checked to be equal to the value set

methods.description: when set true, the xml well-formedness of the result is checked

methods.name: chompCharSize
methods.description: If set (>=0) and the character data length inside a xml element exceeds this size, the character data is chomped (with a clear comment)

methods.name: collectResults
methods.description: Controls whether all the results of each iteration will be collected in one result message. If set false, only a small summary is returned. Setting this attributes to false is often required to enable processing of very large files. N.B. Remember in such a case that setting transactionAttribute to NotSupported might be necessary too

methods.name: combineBlocks
methods.description: If true, all items in a block are sent at once. If set false, items are sent individually, potentially leveraging block enabled sending capabilities of the sender

methods.name: stubFileName
methods.description: when set, the pipe returns a message from a file, instead of doing the regular process

methods.name: styleSheetName
methods.description: Stylesheet to apply to each message, before sending it

methods.name: timeOutOnResult
methods.description: when not empty, a timeoutexception is thrown when the result equals this value (for testing purposes only)

methods.name: transactionAttribute
methods.description:
Defines transaction and isolation behaviour.For developers: it is equalto EJB transaction attribute.Possible values are:
transactionAttributecallers TransactionPipeline excecuted in Transaction
Required noneT2
T1 T1
RequiresNew noneT2
T1 T2
Mandatory noneerror
T1 T1
NotSupportednonenone
T1 none
Supports nonenone
T1 T1
Never nonenone
T1 error

methods.name: transactionAttributeNum
methods.description:
Like transactionAttribute, but the chosen option is represented with a number. The numbers mean:
0Required
1Supports
2Mandatory
3RequiresNew
4NotSupported
5Never

methods.name: transactionTimeout
methods.description: timeout (in seconds) of transaction started to process a message.

methods.name: useInputForExtract
methods.description: when set true, the input of a pipe is used to extract audit trail, correlationid and label (instead of the wrapped input)

methods.name: xpathExpression
methods.description: Alternatively: xpath-expression to create stylesheet from

methods.name: active
methods.description: controls whether pipe is included in configuration. when set false or set to something else as true, (even set to the empty string), the pipe is not included in the configuration

methods.name: chompCharSize
methods.description: If set (>=0) and the character data length inside a xml element exceeds this size, the character data is chomped (with a clear comment)

methods.defaultValue: If durationThreshold >=0 and the duration of the message processing exceeded the value specified (in milliseconds) the message is logged informatory
methods.name: durationThreshold
elementToMove
methods.description: If set, the character data in this element is stored under a session key and in the message replaced by a reference to this session key: {sessionkey: + elementToMoveSessionKey + }

methods.name: elementToMoveChain
methods.description: Like elementToMove but element is preceded with all ancestor elements and separated by semicolons (e.g. 'adapter;pipeline;pipe')

methods.defaultValue: ref_ + the name of the element
methods.name: elementToMoveSessionKey
methods.description: (Only used when elementToMove is set) Name of the session key under which the character data is stored

methods.name: emptyInputReplacement
methods.description: If set and the input is empty, this fixed value is taken as input

methods.name: forwardName
methods.description: Sets the name of the forward that is looked up upon completion.

methods.name: getInputFromFixedValue
methods.description: If set, this fixed value is taken as input, instead of regular input

methods.name: getInputFromSessionKey
methods.description: If set, input is taken from this session key, instead of regular input

methods.name: hideRegex
methods.description: Regular expression to mask strings in the log. For example, the regular expression (?<=<password>).*?(?=</password>) will replace every character between keys '<password>' and '</password>'. note: this feature is used at adapter level, so one pipe affects all pipes in the pipeline (and multiple values in different pipes are merged)

methods.name: ifParam
methods.description: when set, this pipe is only executed when the value of parameter with name ifparam equals ifvalue (otherwise this pipe is skipped)

methods.name: ifValue
methods.description: see ifparam

methods.name: includeXmlDeclaration
methods.description: controls whether a declation is included above the xml text

methods.name: maxThreads
methods.description: maximum number of threads that may call {@link #doPipe(java.lang.Object, nl.nn.adapterframework.core.IPipeLineSession)} simultaneously

methods.name: name
methods.description: name of the pipe

methods.name: namespaceAware
methods.description: controls namespace-awareness of possible xml parsing in descender-classes

methods.name: preserveInput
methods.description: If set true, the result of the pipe is replaced with the original input (i.e. the input before configured replacements of getInputFromSessionKey, getInputFromFixedValue or emptyInputReplacement)

methods.name: replaceNonXmlChars
methods.description: replace all non xml chars (not in the character range as specified by the xml specification) with the inverted question mark (0x00bf)

methods.defaultValue: If set true, compacted messages in the result are restored to their original format (see also {@link #setElementToMove(java.lang.String)})
methods.name: restoreMovedElements

methods.defaultValue: (Only used when writetoseclog=true) Comma separated list of keys of session variables that is appended to the security log record
methods.name: secLogSessionKeys
skipOnEmptyInput
methods.description: when set, the processing continues directly at the forward of this pipe, without executing the pipe itself

methods.name: splitLines
methods.description: controls whether the lines of the input are places in separated <line> tags

methods.name: storeResultInSessionKey
methods.description: If set, the result (before replacing when true) is stored under this session key

methods.name: acceptNamespaceLessXml
methods.description: If true, all xml is allowed to be without namespaces. If no namespaces are detected (by the presence of the string 'xmlns') in the xml string, the root namespace is added to the xml

methods.description: controls whether pipe is included in configuration. when set false or set to something else as true, (even set to the empty string), the pipe is not included in the configuration

methods.name: addNamespaceToSchema
methods.description: If set true, the namespace from schemalocation is added to the schema document as targetnamespace

methods.name: allowPlainXml
methods.description: allow plain xml, without a SOAP Envelope, too

methods.name: autoFormat
methods.description: If true, the format on 'output' is set to the same as the format of the input message on 'input'. The format of the input message is stored in and retrieved from the session variable specified by outputFormatSessionKey

methods.name: charset
methods.description: Characterset used for reading file, only used when validateFile is true

methods.name: chompCharSize
methods.description: If set (>=0) and the character data length inside a xml element exceeds this size, the character data is chomped (with a clear comment)

methods.name: compactJsonArrays
methods.description: If true assume arrays in json do not have the element containers like in xml

methods.name: deepSearch
methods.description: If true, and converting from json to xml, parameter substitutions are searched for optional sub elements too. By default, only mandatory elements are searched for parameter substitutions. N.B. Currenlty this option might cause problems. Please try using more qualified parameters names (using '/') first

methods.description: If true, an exception is thrown when a wildcard is found in the xml schema when parsing an object. This often indicates that an element is not properly typed in the xml schema, and could lead to ambuigities.

methods.name: forwardFailureToSuccess
methods.description: If set true, the failure forward is replaced by the success forward (like a warning mode)

methods.name: forwardName
methods.description: Sets the name of the forward that is looked up upon completion.

methods.name: fullSchemaChecking
methods.description: Perform addional memory intensive checks

methods.description: If set, input is taken from this session key, instead of regular input

methods.name: ignoreCaching
methods.description: If set true, the number for caching validators in appConstants is ignored and no caching is done (for this validator only)

methods.name: importedNamespacesToIgnore
methods.description: Comma separated list of namespaces which are excluded from an import or include in the schema document

methods.name: importedSchemaLocationsToIgnore
methods.description: Comma separated list of schemaLocations which are excluded from an import or include in the schema document

methods.name: inputFormatSessionKey
methods.description: Session key to store the inputformat in, to be able to set the outputformat when autoForamat=true.

methods.name: jsonWithRootElements
methods.description: If true, assume that json contains/must contain a root element

methods.name: lazyInit
methods.description: If set, the value in appconstants is overwritten (for this validator only)

methods.description: maximum number of threads that may call {@link #doPipe(java.lang.Object, nl.nn.adapterframework.core.IPipeLineSession)} simultaneously

methods.description: controls namespace-awareness of possible xml parsing in descender-classes

methods.description: A uri reference as a hint as to the location of a schema document with no target namespace.

methods.description: Default format of the result. Either 'xml' or 'json'

methods.name: outputFormatSessionKey
methods.description: Session key to retrieve outputformat from.

methods.name: outputSoapBody
methods.description: identical to the soapbody attribute except that it's used for the output message instead of the input message. for more information see note 1

methods.name: produceNamespaceLessXml
methods.description: If true, all xml that is generated is without a namespace set

methods.description: If set: key of session variable to store reasons of mis-validation in

methods.description: Name of the response root element, or a comma separated list of names to choose from (only one is allowed)

methods.description: always envelope (not allowed to change)

methods.name: rootElementSessionKey
methods.description: key of session variable to store the name of the root element

methods.name: rootNamespaceSessionKey
methods.description: key of session variable to store the namespace of the root element

methods.name: schema
methods.description: the filename of the schema on the classpath. see doc on the method. (effectively the same as noNamespaceSchemaLocation)

methods.name: schemaLocation
methods.description: Pairs of uri references (one for the namespace name, and one for a hint as to the location of a schema document defining names for that namespace name). see doc on the method.

methods.name: schemaLocationToAdd
methods.description: pairs of uri references which will be added to the wsdl

methods.name: schemaSessionKey
methods.description: session key for retrieving a schema

methods.defaultValue: (Only used when writetoseclog=true) Comma separated list of keys of session variables that is appended to the security log record
methods.name: secLogSessionKeys
skipOnEmptyInput
methods.description: when set, the processing continues directly at the forward of this pipe, without executing the pipe itself

methods.name: soapBody
methods.description: name of the child element of the soap body. or a comma separated list of names to choose from (only one is allowed) (wsdl generator will use the first element) (use empty value to allow an empty soap body, for example to allow element x and an empty soap body use: x,)

methods.name: soapBodyNamespace
methods.description: creates schemalocation attribute based on the wsdl and replaces the namespace of the soap body element

methods.name: soapHeader
methods.description: name of the child element of the soap header. or a comma separated list of names to choose from (only one is allowed) (wsdl generator will use the first element) (use empty value to allow an empty soap header, for example to allow element x and an empty soap header use: x,)

methods.name: soapHeaderNamespace
methods.description: can be used when the soap header element exists multiple times

methods.name: soapNamespace
methods.description: The namespace of the SOAP envelope, when this property has a value and the input message is a SOAP message, the content of the SOAP Body is used for validation, hence the SOAP Envelope and SOAP Body elements are not considered part of the message to validate. Please note that this functionality is deprecated, using {@link nl.nn.adapterframework.soap.SoapValidator} is now the preferred solution in case a SOAP message needs to be validated, in other cases give this property an empty value

methods.name: soapVersion
methods.description: soap envelope xsd version to use: 1.1, 1.2 or any (both 1.1 and 1.2)

methods.name: storeResultInSessionKey
methods.description: If set, the result (before replacing when true) is stored under this session key

methods.name: strictJsonArraySyntax
methods.description: If true check that incoming json adheres to the specified syntax (compact or full), otherwise both types are accepted for conversion from json to xml

methods.name: targetNamespace
methods.description: Only for json input: namespace of the resulting xml. Need only be specified when the namespace of root name is ambiguous in the schema

methods.name: throwException
methods.description: Should the XmlValidator throw a PipeRunexception on a validation error. If not, a forward with name 'failure' must be defined.

methods.name: transactionAttribute
methods.description:
Defines transaction and isolation behaviour.For developers: it is equalto EJB transaction attribute.Possible values are:
transactionAttributecallers TransactionPipeline excecuted in Transaction
Required noneT2
T1 T1
RequiresNew noneT2
T1 T2
Mandatory noneerror
T1 T1
NotSupportednonenone
T1 none
Supports nonenone
T1 T1
Never nonenone
T1 error

methods.name: transactionAttributeNum
methods.description:
Like transactionAttribute, but the chosen option is represented with a number. The numbers mean:
0Required
1Supports
2Mandatory
3RequiresNew
4NotSupported
5Never

methods.name: transactionTimeout
methods.description: timeout (in seconds) of transaction started to process a message.

methods.name: useBaseImportedSchemaLocationsToIgnore
methods.description: If set true, the comparison for importedSchemaLocationsToIgnore is done on base filename without any path

methods.name: validateFile
methods.description: If set true, the input is assumed to be the name of the file to be validated. Otherwise the input itself is validated

methods.name: validateJsonToRootElementOnly
methods.description: If true, and converting to or from json, then the message root is the only rootValidation, ignoring root validations like for SOAP envelope and header set by descender classes like SoapValidator

methods.name: warn
methods.description: If set true, send warnings to logging and console about syntax problems in the configured schema('s)

methods.name: wsdl
methods.description: the wsdl to read the xsd's from

methods.name: xmlReasonSessionKey
methods.description: Like reasonSessionKey but stores reasons in xml format and more extensive

methods.name: xmlSchemaVersion
methods.description: If set to 1.0, Xerces's previous XML Schema factory will be used, which would make all XSD 1.1 features illegal. The default behaviour can also be set with xsd.processor.version property.

methods.name: active
methods.description: controls whether pipe is included in configuration. when set false or set to something else as true, (even set to the empty string), the pipe is not included in the configuration

methods.name: chompCharSize
methods.description: If set (>=0) and the character data length inside a xml element exceeds this size, the character data is chomped (with a clear comment)

methods.defaultValue: If durationThreshold >=0 and the duration of the message processing exceeded the value specified (in milliseconds) the message is logged informatory
methods.name: durationThreshold
elementToMove
methods.description: If set, the character data in this element is stored under a session key and in the message replaced by a reference to this session key: {sessionkey: + elementToMoveSessionKey + }

methods.name: elementToMoveChain
methods.description: Like elementToMove but element is preceded with all ancestor elements and separated by semicolons (e.g. 'adapter;pipeline;pipe')

methods.defaultValue: ref_ + the name of the element
methods.name: elementToMoveSessionKey
methods.description: (Only used when elementToMove is set) Name of the session key under which the character data is stored

methods.name: emptyInputReplacement
methods.description: If set and the input is empty, this fixed value is taken as input

methods.name: forwardName
methods.description: Sets the name of the forward that is looked up upon completion.

methods.name: getInputFromFixedValue
methods.description: If set, this fixed value is taken as input, instead of regular input

methods.name: getInputFromSessionKey
methods.description: If set, input is taken from this session key, instead of regular input

methods.name: hideRegex
methods.description: Regular expression to mask strings in the log. For example, the regular expression (?<=<password>).*?(?=</password>) will replace every character between keys '<password>' and '</password>'. note: this feature is used at adapter level, so one pipe affects all pipes in the pipeline (and multiple values in different pipes are merged)

methods.name: ifParam
methods.description: when set, this pipe is only executed when the value of parameter with name ifparam equals ifvalue (otherwise this pipe is skipped)

methods.name: ifValue
methods.description: see ifparam

methods.name: maxThreads
methods.description: maximum number of threads that may call {@link #doPipe(java.lang.Object, nl.nn.adapterframework.core.IPipeLineSession)} simultaneously

methods.description: name of the pipe

methods.name: namespaceAware
methods.description: controls namespace-awareness of possible xml parsing in descender-classes

methods.name: preserveInput
methods.description: If set true, the result of the pipe is replaced with the original input (i.e. the input before configured replacements of getInputFromSessionKey, getInputFromFixedValue or emptyInputReplacement)

methods.defaultValue: If set true, compacted messages in the result are restored to their original format (see also {@link #setElementToMove(java.lang.String)})
methods.name: restoreMovedElements

methods.defaultValue: (Only used when writetoseclog=true) Comma separated list of keys of session variables that is appended to the security log record

methods.description: When true the input is added to the result in an input element

methods.description: namespace defintions for audittrailxpath. must be in the form of a comma or space separated list of prefix=namespaceuri-definitions

methods.name: auditTrailSessionKey
methods.description: key of a pipelinesession-variable. if specified, the value of the pipelinesession variable is used as audit trail (instead of the default 'no audit trail)

methods.name: auditTrailXPath
methods.description: xpath expression to extract audit trail from message

methods.defaultValue: 0 (one line at a time, no prefix of suffix)
methods.name: blockSize
methods.description: Controls multiline behaviour. when set to a value greater than 0, it specifies the number of rows send in a block to the sender.

methods.name: checkRootTag
methods.description: when set, besides the xml well-formedness the root element of the result is checked to be equal to the value set

methods.name: checkXmlWellFormed
methods.description: when set true, the xml well-formedness of the result is checked

methods.name: chompCharSize
methods.description: If set (>=0) and the character data length inside a xml element exceeds this size, the character data is chomped (with a clear comment)

methods.name: collectResults
methods.description: Controls whether all the results of each iteration will be collected in one result message. If set false, only a small summary is returned. Setting this attributes to false is often required to enable processing of very large files. N.B. Remember in such a case that setting transactionAttribute to NotSupported might be necessary too

methods.name: correlationIDNamespaceDefs
methods.description: namespace defintions for correlationidxpath. must be in the form of a comma or space separated list of prefix=namespaceuri-definitions

methods.name: correlationIDSessionKey
methods.description: key of a pipelinesession-variable. is specified, the value of the pipelinesession variable is used as input for the xpathexpression or stylesheet, instead of the current input message

methods.name: correlationIDStyleSheet
methods.description: stylesheet to extract correlationid from message

methods.name: correlationIDXPath
methods.description: xpath expression to extract correlationid from message

methods.defaultValue: If durationThreshold >=0 and the duration of the message processing exceeded the value specified (in milliseconds) the message is logged informatory

elementChain
methods.description: the name of the element to iterate over, preceded with all ancestor elements and separated by semicolons (e.g. adapter;pipeline;pipe)

methods.name: elementName
methods.description: the name of the element to iterate over (alternatively: elementchain)

methods.name: elementToMove
methods.description: If set, the character data in this element is stored under a session key and in the message replaced by a reference to this session key: {sessionkey: + elementToMoveSessionKey + }

methods.description: (Only used when elementToMove is set) Name of the session key under which the character data is stored

methods.description: If set and the input is empty, this fixed value is taken as input

methods.name: exceptionOnResult
methods.description: when not empty, a piperunexception is thrown when the result equals this value (for testing purposes only)

methods.name: forwardName
methods.description: Sets the name of the forward that is looked up upon completion.

methods.name: getInputFromFixedValue
methods.description: If set, this fixed value is taken as input, instead of regular input

methods.name: getInputFromSessionKey
methods.description: If set, input is taken from this session key, instead of regular input

methods.name: hideMethod
methods.description: (only used when hideregex is not empty and only applies to error/logstore) either all or firsthalf. when firsthalf only the first half of the string is masked, otherwise (all) the entire string is masked

methods.name: hideRegex
methods.description: next to common usage in {@link AbstractPipe}, also strings in the error/logstore are masked

methods.name: ifParam
methods.description: when set, this pipe is only executed when the value of parameter with name ifparam equals ifvalue (otherwise this pipe is skipped)

methods.name: ifValue
methods.description: see ifparam

methods.name: ignoreExceptions
methods.description: When true ignore any exception thrown by executing sender

methods.name: itemNoSessionKey
methods.description: Key of session variable to store number of items processed, i.e. the position or index in the set of items to be processed.

methods.name: labelNamespaceDefs
methods.description: namespace defintions for labelxpath. must be in the form of a comma or space separated list of prefix=namespaceuri-definitions

methods.name: labelStyleSheet
methods.description: stylesheet to extract label from message

methods.name: labelXPath
methods.description: xpath expression to extract label from message

methods.name: linkMethod
methods.description: either MESSAGEID or CORRELATIONID. For asynchronous communication, the server side may either use the messageID or the correlationID in the correlationID field of the reply message. Use this property to set the behaviour of the reply-listener.

methods.name: maxChildThreads
methods.description: maximum number of child threads that may run in parallel simultaneously (combined total of all threads calling this pipe)

methods.name: maxItems
methods.description: The maximum number of items returned. The (default) value of 0 means unlimited, all available items will be returned

methods.name: maxRetries
methods.description: the number of times a processing attempt is retried after a timeout or an exception is caught or after a incorrect reply is received (see also retryxpath)

methods.name: maxThreads
methods.description: maximum number of threads that may call {@link #doPipe(java.lang.Object, nl.nn.adapterframework.core.IPipeLineSession)} simultaneously

methods.name: name
methods.description: name of the pipe

methods.name: namespaceAware
methods.description: controls namespace-awareness of possible xml parsing in descender-classes

methods.name: namespaceDefs
methods.description: Namespace defintions for xpathExpression. Must be in the form of a comma or space separated list of prefix=namespaceuri-definitions. For some use other cases (NOT xpathExpression), one entry can be without a prefix, that will define the default namespace.

methods.name: omitXmlDeclaration
methods.description: Force the transformer generated from the xpath-expression to omit the xml declaration

methods.name: outputType
methods.description: Either 'text' or 'xml'. only valid for xpathexpression

methods.name: parallel
methods.description: When set true, the calls for all items are done in parallel (a new thread is started for each call). when collectresults set true, this pipe will wait for all calls to finish before results are collected and pipe result is returned

methods.name: preserveInput
methods.description: If set true, the result of the pipe is replaced with the original input (i.e. the input before configured replacements of getInputFromSessionKey, getInputFromFixedValue or emptyInputReplacement)

methods.name: presumedTimeOutInterval
methods.description: when the previous call was a timeout, the maximum time (in seconds) after this timeout to presume the current call is also a timeout. a value of -1 indicates to never presume timeouts

methods.name: removeDuplicates
methods.description: When true duplicate input elements are removed, i.e. they are handled only once

methods.name: removeXmlDeclarationInResults
methods.description: Postprocess each partial result, to remove the xml-declaration, as this is not allowed inside an xml-document

methods.defaultValue: If set true, compacted messages in the result are restored to their original format (see also {@link #setElementToMove(java.lang.String)})
methods.name: restoreMovedElements
resultOnTimeOut
methods.description: result returned when no return-message was received within the timeout limit (e.g. 'receiver timed out').

methods.name: retryMaxInterval
methods.description: the maximum number of seconds waited after an unsuccessful processing attempt before another processing attempt is made

methods.name: retryMinInterval
methods.description: the starting number of seconds waited after an unsuccessful processing attempt before another processing attempt is made. each next retry this interval is doubled with a upper limit of retrymaxinterval

methods.name: retryNamespaceDefs
methods.description: namespace defintions for retryxpath. must be in the form of a comma or space separated list of prefix=namespaceuri-definitions

methods.name: retryXPath
methods.description: xpath expression evaluated on each technical successful reply. retry is done if condition returns true

methods.defaultValue: (Only used when writetoseclog=true) Comma separated list of keys of session variables that is appended to the security log record
methods.name: secLogSessionKeys
skipOnEmptyInput
methods.description: when set, the processing continues directly at the forward of this pipe, without executing the pipe itself

methods.name: stopConditionXPathExpression
methods.description: Expression evaluated on each result if set. Iteration stops if condition returns anything other than an empty result. To test for the root element to have an attribute 'finished' with the value 'yes', the expression *[@finished='yes'] can be used. This can be used if the condition to stop can be derived from the item result. To stop after a maximum number of items has been processed, use maxItems.Previous versions documented that position()=2 could be used. This is not working as expected; Use maxItems instead

methods.name: storeResultInSessionKey
methods.description: If set, the result (before replacing when true) is stored under this session key

methods.name: streamResultToServlet
methods.description: if set, the result is first base64 decoded and then streamed to the httpservletresponse object

methods.name: streamingActive
methods.description: If true, then this pipe can provide an OutputStream to the previous pipe, to write its output to. Can be used to switch this streaming off for debugging purposes

methods.name: stubFileName
methods.description: when set, the pipe returns a message from a file, instead of doing the regular process

methods.name: styleSheetName
methods.description: Stylesheet to apply to each message, before sending it

methods.name: timeOutOnResult
methods.description: when not empty, a timeoutexception is thrown when the result equals this value (for testing purposes only)

methods.description: either MESSAGEID or CORRELATIONID. For asynchronous communication, the server side may either use the messageID or the correlationID in the correlationID field of the reply message. Use this property to set the behaviour of the reply-listener.

methods.name: maxChildThreads
methods.description: maximum number of child threads that may run in parallel simultaneously (combined total of all threads calling this pipe)

methods.name: maxItems
methods.description: The maximum number of items returned. The (default) value of 0 means unlimited, all available items will be returned

methods.name: maxRetries
methods.description: the number of times a processing attempt is retried after a timeout or an exception is caught or after a incorrect reply is received (see also retryxpath)

methods.name: maxThreads
methods.description: maximum number of threads that may call {@link #doPipe(java.lang.Object, nl.nn.adapterframework.core.IPipeLineSession)} simultaneously

methods.name: omitXmlDeclaration
methods.description: Force the transformer generated from the xpath-expression to omit the xml declaration

methods.name: outputType
methods.description: Either 'text' or 'xml'. only valid for xpathexpression

methods.name: parallel
methods.description: When set true, the calls for all items are done in parallel (a new thread is started for each call). when collectresults set true, this pipe will wait for all calls to finish before results are collected and pipe result is returned

methods.name: preserveInput
methods.description: If set true, the result of the pipe is replaced with the original input (i.e. the input before configured replacements of getInputFromSessionKey, getInputFromFixedValue or emptyInputReplacement)

methods.name: presumedTimeOutInterval
methods.description: when the previous call was a timeout, the maximum time (in seconds) after this timeout to presume the current call is also a timeout. a value of -1 indicates to never presume timeouts

methods.name: removeDuplicates
methods.description: When true duplicate input elements are removed, i.e. they are handled only once

methods.name: removeXmlDeclarationInResults
methods.description: Postprocess each partial result, to remove the xml-declaration, as this is not allowed inside an xml-document

methods.defaultValue: If set true, compacted messages in the result are restored to their original format (see also {@link #setElementToMove(java.lang.String)})
methods.name: restoreMovedElements
resultOnTimeOut
methods.description: result returned when no return-message was received within the timeout limit (e.g. 'receiver timed out').

methods.name: retryMaxInterval
methods.description: the maximum number of seconds waited after an unsuccessful processing attempt before another processing attempt is made

methods.name: retryMinInterval
methods.description: the starting number of seconds waited after an unsuccessful processing attempt before another processing attempt is made. each next retry this interval is doubled with a upper limit of retrymaxinterval

methods.name: retryNamespaceDefs
methods.description: namespace defintions for retryxpath. must be in the form of a comma or space separated list of prefix=namespaceuri-definitions

methods.name: retryXPath
methods.description: xpath expression evaluated on each technical successful reply. retry is done if condition returns true

methods.defaultValue: (Only used when writetoseclog=true) Comma separated list of keys of session variables that is appended to the security log record
methods.name: secLogSessionKeys
skipBOM
methods.description: when set to true, a possible bytes order mark (bom) at the start of the file is skipped (only used for encoding uft-8)

methods.name: skipOnEmptyInput
methods.description: when set, the processing continues directly at the forward of this pipe, without executing the pipe itself

methods.name: stopConditionXPathExpression
methods.description: Expression evaluated on each result if set. Iteration stops if condition returns anything other than an empty result. To test for the root element to have an attribute 'finished' with the value 'yes', the expression *[@finished='yes'] can be used. This can be used if the condition to stop can be derived from the item result. To stop after a maximum number of items has been processed, use maxItems.Previous versions documented that position()=2 could be used. This is not working as expected; Use maxItems instead

methods.name: storeResultInSessionKey
methods.description: If set, the result (before replacing when true) is stored under this session key

methods.name: streamResultToServlet
methods.description: if set, the result is first base64 decoded and then streamed to the httpservletresponse object

methods.name: streamingActive
methods.description: If true, then this pipe can provide an OutputStream to the previous pipe, to write its output to. Can be used to switch this streaming off for debugging purposes

methods.name: streamingContents
methods.description: when set to false, a string containing the contents of the entry is placed under the session key, instead of the inputstream to the contents

methods.name: stubFileName
methods.description: when set, the pipe returns a message from a file, instead of doing the regular process

methods.name: styleSheetName
methods.description: Stylesheet to apply to each message, before sending it

methods.name: timeOutOnResult
methods.description: when not empty, a timeoutexception is thrown when the result equals this value (for testing purposes only)

methods.name: transactionAttribute
methods.description:
Defines transaction and isolation behaviour.For developers: it is equalto EJB transaction attribute.Possible values are:
transactionAttributecallers TransactionPipeline excecuted in Transaction
Required noneT2
T1 T1
RequiresNew noneT2
T1 T2
Mandatory noneerror
T1 T1
NotSupportednonenone
T1 none
Supports nonenone
T1 T1
Never nonenone
T1 error

methods.name: transactionAttributeNum
methods.description:
Like transactionAttribute, but the chosen option is represented with a number. The numbers mean:
0Required
1Supports
2Mandatory
3RequiresNew
4NotSupported
5Never

methods.name: transactionTimeout
methods.description: timeout (in seconds) of transaction started to process a message.

methods.name: useInputForExtract
methods.description: when set true, the input of a pipe is used to extract audit trail, correlationid and label (instead of the wrapped input)

methods.name: xpathExpression
methods.description: Alternatively: xpath-expression to create stylesheet from

methods.name: action
methods.description:
one of
  • open: to open a new zip file or stream
  • close: to close the zip file or stream
  • write: write the input to the zip as a new entry
  • stream: create a new zip entry, and provide an outputstream that another pipe can use to write the contents

methods.name: active
methods.description: controls whether pipe is included in configuration. when set false or set to something else as true, (even set to the empty string), the pipe is not included in the configuration

methods.name: charset
methods.description: only for action='write': charset used to write strings to zip entries

methods.name: chompCharSize
methods.description: If set (>=0) and the character data length inside a xml element exceeds this size, the character data is chomped (with a clear comment)

methods.name: closeInputstreamOnExit
methods.description: only for action='write': when set to false, the inputstream is not closed after the zip entry is written

methods.name: closeOutputstreamOnExit
methods.description: only for action='open': when set to false, the outputstream is not closed after the zip creation is finished

methods.name: completeFileHeader
methods.description: only for action='write': when set to true, the fields 'crc-32', 'compressed size' and 'uncompressed size' in the zip entry file header are set explicitly (note: compression ratio is zero)

methods.defaultValue: If durationThreshold >=0 and the duration of the message processing exceeded the value specified (in milliseconds) the message is logged informatory
methods.name: durationThreshold
elementToMove
methods.description: If set, the character data in this element is stored under a session key and in the message replaced by a reference to this session key: {sessionkey: + elementToMoveSessionKey + }

methods.name: elementToMoveChain
methods.description: Like elementToMove but element is preceded with all ancestor elements and separated by semicolons (e.g. 'adapter;pipeline;pipe')

methods.defaultValue: ref_ + the name of the element
methods.name: elementToMoveSessionKey
methods.description: (Only used when elementToMove is set) Name of the session key under which the character data is stored

methods.name: emptyInputReplacement
methods.description: If set and the input is empty, this fixed value is taken as input

methods.name: forwardName
methods.description: Sets the name of the forward that is looked up upon completion.

methods.name: getInputFromFixedValue
methods.description: If set, this fixed value is taken as input, instead of regular input

methods.name: getInputFromSessionKey
methods.description: If set, input is taken from this session key, instead of regular input

methods.name: hideRegex
methods.description: Regular expression to mask strings in the log. For example, the regular expression (?<=<password>).*?(?=</password>) will replace every character between keys '<password>' and '</password>'. note: this feature is used at adapter level, so one pipe affects all pipes in the pipeline (and multiple values in different pipes are merged)

methods.name: ifParam
methods.description: when set, this pipe is only executed when the value of parameter with name ifparam equals ifvalue (otherwise this pipe is skipped)

methods.name: ifValue
methods.description: see ifparam

methods.name: maxThreads
methods.description: maximum number of threads that may call {@link #doPipe(java.lang.Object, nl.nn.adapterframework.core.IPipeLineSession)} simultaneously

methods.name: name
methods.description: name of the pipe

methods.name: namespaceAware
methods.description: controls namespace-awareness of possible xml parsing in descender-classes

methods.name: preserveInput
methods.description: If set true, the result of the pipe is replaced with the original input (i.e. the input before configured replacements of getInputFromSessionKey, getInputFromFixedValue or emptyInputReplacement)

methods.defaultValue: If set true, compacted messages in the result are restored to their original format (see also {@link #setElementToMove(java.lang.String)})
methods.name: restoreMovedElements

methods.defaultValue: (Only used when writetoseclog=true) Comma separated list of keys of session variables that is appended to the security log record
methods.name: secLogSessionKeys
skipOnEmptyInput
methods.description: when set, the processing continues directly at the forward of this pipe, without executing the pipe itself

methods.name: storeResultInSessionKey
methods.description: If set, the result (before replacing when true) is stored under this session key

methods.name: transactionAttribute
methods.description:
Defines transaction and isolation behaviour.For developers: it is equalto EJB transaction attribute.Possible values are:
transactionAttributecallers TransactionPipeline excecuted in Transaction
Required noneT2
T1 T1
RequiresNew noneT2
T1 T2
Mandatory noneerror
T1 T1
NotSupportednonenone
T1 none
Supports nonenone
T1 T1
Never nonenone
T1 error

methods.name: transactionAttributeNum
methods.description:
Like transactionAttribute, but the chosen option is represented with a number. The numbers mean:
0Required
1Supports
2Mandatory
3RequiresNew
4NotSupported
5Never

methods.name: transactionTimeout
methods.description: timeout (in seconds) of transaction started to process a message.

methods.name: zipWriterHandle
methods.description: session key used to refer to zip session. must be used if zipwriterpipes are nested

methods.name: authAlias
methods.description: Authentication alias used to authenticate when connecting to database

methods.name: authentication
methods.description: maps to the field context.security_authentication

methods.name: blobsCompressed
methods.description: when set to true, the messages are stored compressed

methods.name: commentField
methods.description: the name of the column comments are stored in

methods.name: correlationIdField
methods.description: the name of the column correlation-ids are stored in

methods.name: createTable
methods.description: when set to true, the table is created if it does not exist

methods.name: credentials
methods.description: username to connect to context, maps to context.security_credentials

methods.name: datasourceName
methods.description: JNDI name of datasource to be used, can be configured via jmsRealm, too

methods.name: dateField
methods.description: the name of the column the timestamp is stored in

methods.name: dateFieldType
methods.description: the type of the column the timestamps are stored in

methods.name: expiryDateField
methods.description: the name of the column the timestamp for expiry is stored in

methods.name: hideMethod
methods.description: (Only used when hideRegex is not empty) either all or firstHalf. When firstHalf only the first half of the string is masked, otherwise (all) the entire string is masked

methods.name: hideRegex
methods.description: Regular expression to mask strings in the errorStore/logStore. Every character between to the strings in this expression will be replaced by a '*'. For example, the regular expression (?<=<party>).*?(?=</party>) will replace every character between keys<party> and </party>

methods.name: hostField
methods.description: the name of the column that stores the hostname of the server

methods.name: idField
methods.description: the name of the column messageids are stored in

methods.name: indexName
methods.description: the name of the index, to be used in hints for query optimizer too (only for oracle)

methods.name: initialContextFactoryName
methods.description: class to use as initial context factory

methods.name: jndiAuthAlias
methods.description: authentication alias, may be used to override principal and credential-settings

methods.name: keyField
methods.description: the name of the column that contains the primary key of the table

methods.name: keyFieldType
methods.description: the type of the column that contains the primary key of the table

methods.name: labelField
methods.description: the name of the column labels are stored in

methods.name: messageField
methods.description: the name of the column message themselves are stored in

methods.name: messageFieldType
methods.description: the type of the column message themselves are stored in

methods.name: name
methods.description: Name of the sender

methods.name: password
methods.description: Password for authentication when connecting to database, when none found from authAlias

methods.name: prefix
methods.description: prefix to be prefixed on all database objects (tables, indices, sequences), e.q. to access a different oracle schema

methods.name: principal
methods.description: username to connect to context, maps to context.security_principal

methods.name: retention
methods.description: the time (in days) to keep the record in the database before making it eligible for deletion by a cleanup process. when set to -1, the record will live on forever

methods.name: schemaOwner4Check
methods.description: schema owner to be used to check the database

methods.name: securityProtocol
methods.description: maps to the field context.security_protocol

methods.name: sequenceName
methods.description: the name of the sequence used to generate the primary key (only for oracle) n.b. the default name has been changed in version 4.6

methods.name: slotIdField
methods.description: the name of the column slotids are stored in

methods.name: storeFullMessage
methods.description: when set to true, the full message is stored with the log. can be set to false to reduce table size, by avoiding to store the full message

methods.name: tableName
methods.description: the name of the table messages are stored in

methods.name: textFieldType
methods.description: the type of the columns messageid and correlationid, slotid and comments are stored in. n.b. (100) is appended for id's, (1000) is appended for comments.

methods.defaultValue: E for errorstorage on receiver, A for messageLog on receiver and L for messageLog on Pipe
methods.name: type
methods.description: Possible values are E (error store), M (message store), L (message log for pipe) or A (message log for receiver). ReceiverBase will always set type to E for errorStorage and always set type to A for messageLog. GenericMessageSendingPipe will set type to L for messageLog (when type isn't specified). See {@link MessagestoreSender} for type M

methods.name: typeField
methods.description: the name of the column types are stored in

methods.name: urlPkgPrefixes
methods.description: maps to the field context.url_pkg_prefixes

methods.name: username
methods.description: User name for authentication when connecting to database, when none found from authAlias

methods.name: authAlias
methods.description: alias used to obtain credentials for authentication to jms server

methods.name: authentication
methods.description: maps to the field context.security_authentication

methods.name: correlationIdMaxLength
methods.description: if set (>=0) and the length of the correlationid exceeds this maximum length, the correlationid is trimmed from the left side of a string to this maximum length

methods.name: correlationIdToHex
methods.description: transform the value of the correlationid to a hexadecimal value if it starts with id: (preserving the id: part). useful when sending messages to mq which expects this value to be in hexadecimal format when it starts with id:, otherwise generating the error: mqjms1044: string is not a valid hexadecimal number

methods.name: correlationIdToHexPrefix
methods.description: prefix to check before executing correlationidtohex. when empty (and correlationidtohex equals true) all correlationid's are transformed, this is useful in case you want the entire correlationid to be transformed (for example when the receiving party doesn't allow characters like a colon to be present in the correlationid).

methods.name: credentials
methods.description: username to connect to context, maps to context.security_credentials

methods.name: destinationName
methods.description: name of the jms destination (queue or topic) to use

methods.name: destinationType
methods.description: either queue or topic

methods.name: hideMethod
methods.description: (Only used when hideRegex is not empty) either all or firstHalf. When firstHalf only the first half of the string is masked, otherwise (all) the entire string is masked

methods.name: hideRegex
methods.description: Regular expression to mask strings in the errorStore/logStore. Every character between to the strings in this expression will be replaced by a '*'. For example, the regular expression (?<=<party>).*?(?=</party>) will replace every character between keys<party> and </party>

methods.name: initialContextFactoryName
methods.description: class to use as initial context factory

methods.name: jndiAuthAlias
methods.description: authentication alias, may be used to override principal and credential-settings

methods.name: lookupDestination
methods.description: when set false, the destinationname is used directly instead of performing a jndi lookup

methods.name: messageSelector
methods.description: when set, the value of this attribute is used as a selector to filter messages.

methods.name: messageTimeToLive
methods.description: the time (in milliseconds) it takes for the message to expire. if the message is not consumed before, it will be lost. make sure to set it to a positive value for request/repy type of messages.

methods.name: name
methods.description: name of the listener

methods.name: persistent
methods.description: rather useless attribute, and not the same as deliverymode. you probably want to use that.

methods.name: principal
methods.description: username to connect to context, maps to context.security_principal

methods.name: queueConnectionFactoryName
methods.description: jndi-name of the queueconnectionfactory, used when destinationtype=queue

methods.name: securityProtocol
methods.description: maps to the field context.security_protocol

methods.name: timeOut
methods.description: timeout for receiving a message from the queue

methods.name: topicConnectionFactoryName
methods.description: jndi-name of the topicconnectionfactory, used when destinationtype=topic

methods.description: if set (>=0) and the length of the correlationid exceeds this maximum length, the correlationid is trimmed from the left side of a string to this maximum length

methods.name: correlationIdToHex
methods.description: transform the value of the correlationid to a hexadecimal value if it starts with id: (preserving the id: part). useful when sending messages to mq which expects this value to be in hexadecimal format when it starts with id:, otherwise generating the error: mqjms1044: string is not a valid hexadecimal number

methods.name: correlationIdToHexPrefix
methods.description: prefix to check before executing correlationidtohex. when empty (and correlationidtohex equals true) all correlationid's are transformed, this is useful in case you want the entire correlationid to be transformed (for example when the receiving party doesn't allow characters like a colon to be present in the correlationid).
