methods.description: Charset that is used to read and write BLOBs. This assumes the blob contains character data. If blobCharset and blobSessionKey are not set, blobs are base64 encoded after being read to accommodate for the fact that senders need to return a String

methods.name: blobColumn
methods.description: Only for querytype 'updateBlob': column that contains the BLOB to be updated

methods.name: blobSessionKey
methods.description:
For querytype 'updateBlob': key of session variable that contains the data (String or InputStream) to be loaded to the BLOB. When empty, the input of the pipe, which then must be a String, is used.
For querytype 'select': key of session variable that contains the OutputStream, Writer or Filename to write the BLOB to

methods.name: blobSmartGet
methods.description: Controls automatically whether blobdata is stored compressed and/or serialized in the database

methods.name: blobsCompressed
methods.description: controls whether blobdata is stored compressed in the database

methods.name: clobColumn
methods.description: Only for querytype 'updateClob': column that contains the CLOB to be updated

methods.name: clobSessionKey
methods.description:
For querytype 'updateClob': key of session variable that contains the CLOB (String or InputStream) to be loaded to the CLOB. When empty, the input of the pipe, which then must be a String, is used.
For querytype 'select': key of session variable that contains the OutputStream, Writer or Filename to write the CLOB to

methods.name: closeInputstreamOnExit
methods.description: When set to false, the Inputstream is not closed after it has been used to read a BLOB or CLOB

methods.name: closeOutputstreamOnExit
methods.description: When set to false, the Outputstream is not closed after BLOB or CLOB has been written to it

methods.name: columnsReturned
methods.description: Comma separated list of columns whose values are to be returned. Works only if the driver implements jdbc 3.0 getGeneratedKeys()

methods.name: credentials
methods.description: username to connect to context, maps to context.security_credentials

methods.name: datasourceName
methods.description: JNDI name of datasource to be used, can be configured via jmsRealm, too

methods.name: fileNameSessionKey
methods.description: the session key that contains the name of the file to use

methods.name: includeFieldDefinition
methods.description: when true, the result contains besides the returned rows also a header with information about the fetched fields

methods.name: initialContextFactoryName
methods.description: class to use as initial context factory

methods.name: jndiAuthAlias
methods.description: authentication alias, may be used to override principal and credential-settings

methods.name: lockRows
methods.description: When set true, exclusive row-level locks are obtained on all the rows identified by the select statement (e.g. by appending ' FOR UPDATE NOWAIT SKIP LOCKED' to the end of the query)

methods.name: lockWait
methods.description: when set and >=0, ' FOR UPDATE WAIT #' is used instead of ' FOR UPDATE NOWAIT SKIP LOCKED'

methods.name: maxRecordsSessionKey
methods.description: when set (and >=0), this session key contains the maximum number of records which are processed. if query contains a group field (3), then also following records with the same group field value as the last record are processed

methods.name: maxRows
methods.description: The maximum number of rows to be returned from the output of select queries

methods.name: name
methods.description: Name of the sender

methods.name: nullValue
methods.description: Value used in result as contents of fields that contain no value (sql-null)

methods.name: password
methods.description: Password for authentication when connecting to database, when none found from authAlias

methods.name: principal
methods.description: username to connect to context, maps to context.security_principal

methods.name: query
methods.description: The SQL query text to be excecuted each time sendMessage() is called

methods.name: queryType
methods.description:
One of:
  • select for queries that return data
  • updateBlob for queries that update a BLOB
  • updateClob for queries that update a CLOB
  • package to execute Oracle PL/SQL package
  • other or anything else for queries that return no data.

methods.name: resultQuery
methods.description: Query that can be used to obtain result of side-effect of update-query, like generated value of sequence. Example: SELECT mysequence.currval FROM dual

methods.name: rowIdSessionKey
methods.description: If specified, the rowid of the processed row is put in the pipelinesession under the specified key (only applicable for querytype=other). Note: If multiple rows are processed a SqlException is thrown.

methods.name: scalar
methods.description: When true, the value of the first column of the first row (or the startrow) is returned as the only result, as a simple non-xml value

methods.name: scalarExtended
methods.description:
When true and scalar is also true, but returns no value, one of the following is returned:
  • '[absent]' no row is found
  • '[null]' a row is found, but the value is a SQL-NULL
  • '[empty]' a row is found, but the value is a empty string

methods.name: securityProtocol
methods.description: maps to the field context.security_protocol

methods.name: sqlDialect
methods.description: If set, the SQL dialect in which the queries are written and should be translated from to the actual SQL dialect

methods.name: startRow
methods.description: The number of the first row to be returned from the output of select queries. Rows before this are skipped from the output.

methods.name: statusFieldType
methods.description: type of the optional status field which is set after the row is written to the file: timestamp

methods.name: streamCharset
methods.description: Charset used when reading a stream (that is e.g. going to be written to a BLOB or CLOB). When empty, the stream is copied directly to the BLOB, without conversion

methods.name: streamResultToServlet
methods.description: If set, the result is streamed to the HttpServletResponse object of the RestServiceDispatcher (instead of passed as a String)

methods.name: timeout
methods.description: The number of seconds the driver will wait for a statement object to execute. If the limit is exceeded, a TimeoutException is thrown. A value of 0 means execution time is not limited

methods.name: trimSpaces
methods.description: Remove trailing blanks from all result values.

methods.name: urlPkgPrefixes
methods.description: maps to the field context.url_pkg_prefixes

methods.name: useNamedParams
methods.description: When true, every string in the message which equals ?{paramname+UNP_END+ will be replaced by the setter method for the corresponding parameter. The parameters don't need to be in the correct order and unused parameters are skipped.

methods.name: username
methods.description: User name for authentication when connecting to database, when none found from authAlias

methods.name: action
methods.description: Possible values: list, info, read, readDelete, move, copy, delete, mkdir, rmdir, write, append, rename

methods.name: authAlias
methods.description: alias used to obtain credentials for the smb share

methods.name: base64
methods.description: Can be set to 'encode' or 'decode' for actions read, write and append. When set the stream is base64 encoded or decoded, respectively

methods.name: createFolder
methods.description: when set to true, the folder to move to is created if it does not exist

methods.name: destination
methods.description: destination for move, copy or rename. If not set, the parameter destination is used. When that is not set either, the input is used

methods.name: domain
methods.description: in case the user account is bound to a domain

methods.name: filename
methods.description: filename to operate on. When not set, the parameter filename is used. When that is not set either, the input is used

methods.name: force
methods.description: controls whether hidden files are seen or not

methods.name: inputFolder
methods.description: Folder that is scanned for files when action=list. When not set, the root is scanned

methods.name: name
methods.description: name of the sender

methods.name: numberOfBackups
methods.description: for action=write, and for action=append with rotateSize>0: the number of backup files that is kept. The inputFolder must point to the directory where the file resides

methods.name: password
methods.description: the smb share password

methods.name: rotateDays
methods.description: for action=append: when set to a positive number, the file is rotated each day, and this number of files is kept. The inputFolder must point to the directory where the file resides

methods.name: rotateSize
methods.description: for action=append: when set to a positive number, the file is rotated when it has reached the specified size, and the number of files specified in numberOfBackups is kept. Size is specified in plain bytes, suffixes like 'K', 'M' or 'G' are not recognized. The inputFolder must point to the directory where the file resides

methods.name: share
methods.description: Shared folder name in the samba server

methods.name: username
methods.description: the smb share username

methods.name: authType
methods.description: Type of the authentication either 'NTLM' or 'SPNEGO'

methods.name: share
methods.description: the destination, aka smb://xxx/yyy share

methods.name: cronExpressionPattern
methods.description: expression that generates the cron trigger

methods.name: javaListener
methods.description: java listener to be called when scheduler trigger fires

methods.name: jobGroup
methods.description: job group in which the new trigger is to be created (optional)

methods.name: jobNamePattern
methods.description: pattern that leads to the name of the registered trigger(optional)

methods.name: name
methods.description: name of the sender

methods.name: allowSelfSignedCertificates
methods.description: when true, self signed certificates are accepted

methods.name: authAlias
methods.description: authAlias used to obtain credentials for authentication

methods.name: bounceAddress
methods.description: NDR return address when mail cannot be delivered. This adds a Return-Path header

methods.name: certificate
methods.description: resource url to certificate to be used for authentication

methods.name: certificateAuthAlias
methods.description: alias used to obtain truststore password

methods.name: certificatePassword
methods.description: certificate password

methods.name: defaultAttachmentName
methods.description: when this name is used, it will be followed by a number which is equal to the node's position

methods.name: defaultFrom
methods.description: value of the from: header if not specified in message itself

methods.name: defaultMessageBase64
methods.description: when messageBase64 is not specified defaultMessageBase64 will be used

methods.name: defaultMessageType
methods.description: when messageType is not specified defaultMessageType will be used

methods.name: defaultSubject
methods.description: value of the subject: header if not specified in message itself

methods.name: followRedirects
methods.description: when true, a redirect request will be honoured, e.g. to switch to https

methods.name: ignoreCertificateExpiredException
methods.description: when true, the certificateexpiredexception is ignored

methods.name: maxConnections
methods.description: the maximum number of concurrent connections

methods.name: maxExecuteRetries
methods.description: the maximum number of times it the execution is retried

methods.name: name
methods.description: name of the sender

methods.name: password
methods.description: password of userid

methods.name: protocol
methods.description: Secure socket protocol (such as 'SSL' and 'TLS') to use when a SSLContext object is generated. If empty the protocol 'SSL' is used

methods.name: proxyAuthAlias
methods.description: alias used to obtain credentials for proxy authentication

methods.name: proxyHost
methods.description: hostname of the proxy

methods.name: proxyPassword
methods.description: password used to obtain credentials for proxy authentication

methods.name: proxyPort
methods.description: port of the proxy

methods.name: proxyRealm
methods.description: realm used for proxy authentication

methods.name: proxyUserName
methods.description: username used to obtain credentials for proxy authentication

methods.name: smtpAuthAlias
methods.description: alias used to obtain credentials for authentication to smtphost

methods.name: smtpPassword
methods.description: password of userid on the smtphost

methods.name: smtpUserid
methods.description: userId on the smtphost

methods.name: staleChecking
methods.description: controls whether connections checked to be stale, i.e. appear open, but are not.

methods.name: staleTimeout
methods.description: Used when StaleChecking=true. Timeout when stale connections should be closed.

methods.name: timeout
methods.description: timeout in ms of obtaining a connection/result. 0 means no timeout

methods.name: truststore
methods.description: resource url to truststore to be used for authentication

methods.name: truststoreAuthAlias
methods.description: alias used to obtain truststore password

methods.name: truststorePassword
methods.description: truststore password

methods.name: truststoreType
methods.description: type of truststore

methods.name: userId
methods.description: userId on the smtphost

methods.name: verifyHostname
methods.description: when true, the hostname in the certificate will be checked against the actual hostname

methods.name: getInputFromFixedValue
methods.description: If set, this fixed value is taken as input, instead of regular input

methods.name: getInputFromSessionKey
methods.description: If set, input is taken from this session key, instead of regular input

methods.name: maxConcurrentThreads
methods.description: sets and upper limit to the amount of concurrent threads that can be run simultaneously. use 0 to disable.

methods.name: name
methods.description: name of the sender

methods.name: originalSender
methods.description: the default or original sender

methods.name: preserveInput
methods.description: If set true, the input of a pipe is restored before processing the next one

methods.name: resultSender
methods.description: the sender which will process all results

methods.name: storeResultInSessionKey
methods.description: If set, the result is stored under this session key

methods.name: authAlias
methods.description: alias used to obtain credentials for authentication to jms server

methods.name: authentication
methods.description: maps to the field context.security_authentication

methods.name: correlationIdMaxLength
methods.description: if set (>=0) and the length of the correlationid exceeds this maximum length, the correlationid is trimmed from the left side of a string to this maximum length

methods.name: correlationIdToHex
methods.description: transform the value of the correlationid to a hexadecimal value if it starts with id: (preserving the id: part). useful when sending messages to mq which expects this value to be in hexadecimal format when it starts with id:, otherwise generating the error: mqjms1044: string is not a valid hexadecimal number

methods.name: correlationIdToHexPrefix
methods.description: prefix to check before executing correlationidtohex. when empty (and correlationidtohex equals true) all correlationid's are transformed, this is useful in case you want the entire correlationid to be transformed (for example when the receiving party doesn't allow characters like a colon to be present in the correlationid).

methods.name: credentials
methods.description: username to connect to context, maps to context.security_credentials

methods.name: deliveryMode
methods.description: controls mode that messages are sent with: either 'persistent' or 'non_persistent'

methods.name: destinationName
methods.description: name of the jms destination (queue or topic) to use

methods.name: destinationType
methods.description: either queue or topic

methods.name: initialContextFactoryName
methods.description: class to use as initial context factory

methods.name: jndiAuthAlias
methods.description: authentication alias, may be used to override principal and credential-settings

methods.name: linkMethod
methods.description: (only used when synchronous='true' and and replytoname is set) eithter 'correlationid', 'correlationid_from_message' or 'messageid'. indicates wether the server uses the correlationid from the pipeline, the correlationid from the message or the messageid in the correlationid field of the reply. this requires the sender to have set the correlationid at the time of sending.

methods.name: lookupDestination
methods.description: when set false, the destinationname is used directly instead of performing a jndi lookup

methods.name: messageSelector
methods.description: when set, the value of this attribute is used as a selector to filter messages.

methods.name: messageTimeToLive
methods.description: the time (in milliseconds) it takes for the message to expire. if the message is not consumed before, it will be lost. make sure to set it to a positive value for request/repy type of messages.

methods.name: messageType
methods.description: value of the jmstype field

methods.name: name
methods.description: name of the listener

methods.name: persistent
methods.description: rather useless attribute, and not the same as deliverymode. you probably want to use that.

methods.name: principal
methods.description: username to connect to context, maps to context.security_principal

methods.name: priority
methods.description: sets the priority that is used to deliver the message. ranges from 0 to 9. defaults to -1, meaning not set. effectively the default priority is set by jms to 4

methods.name: queueConnectionFactoryName
methods.description: jndi-name of the queueconnectionfactory, used when destinationtype=queue

methods.name: replySoapHeaderSessionKey
methods.description: session key to store soap header of reply

methods.name: replyTimeout
methods.description: maximum time in ms to wait for a reply. 0 means no timeout. (only for synchronous=true)

methods.name: replyToName
methods.description: name of the queue the reply is expected on. this value is send in the jmsreplyto-header with the message.

methods.name: responseHeadersToSessionKeys
methods.description: a list with jms headers to add to the ipipelinesession

methods.name: securityProtocol
methods.description: maps to the field context.security_protocol

methods.name: soap
methods.description: when true, messages sent are put in a soap envelope

methods.name: soapAction
methods.description: soapaction string sent as messageproperty

methods.name: soapHeaderParam
methods.description: name of parameter containing soap header

methods.name: synchronous
methods.description: when true, the sender operates in rr mode: the a reply is expected, either on the queue specified in 'replytoname', or on a dynamically generated temporary queue

methods.name: topicConnectionFactoryName
methods.description: jndi-name of the topicconnectionfactory, used when destinationtype=topic

methods.name: urlPkgPrefixes
methods.description: maps to the field context.url_pkg_prefixes

methods.name: allowSelfSignedCertificates
methods.description: when true, self signed certificates are accepted

methods.name: authAlias
methods.description: alias used to obtain credentials for authentication to host

methods.name: authDomain
methods.description: domain used in authentication to host

methods.name: base64
methods.description: when true, the result is base64 encoded

methods.name: certificate
methods.description: resource url to certificate to be used for authentication

methods.name: certificateAuthAlias
methods.description: alias used to obtain certificate password

methods.name: certificatePassword
methods.description: certificate password

methods.name: charSet
methods.description: charset of the request. Typically only used on PUT and POST requests.

methods.name: contentType
methods.description: content-type (superset of mimetype + charset) of the request, for POST and PUT methods

methods.name: disableCookies
methods.description: Disables the use of cookies, making the sender completely stateless

methods.name: encodeMessages
methods.description: specifies whether messages will encoded, e.g. spaces will be replaced by '+' etc.

methods.name: encodingStyle
methods.description: the encodingstyle to be set in the messageheader

methods.name: followRedirects
methods.description: when true, a redirect request will be honoured, e.g. to switch to https

methods.name: headersParams
methods.description: comma separated list of parameter names which should be set as http headers

methods.name: ignoreCertificateExpiredException
methods.description: when true, the certificateexpiredexception is ignored

methods.name: ignoreRedirects
methods.description: When true, besides http status code 200 (OK) also the code 301 (MOVED_PERMANENTLY), 302 (MOVED_TEMPORARILY) and 307 (TEMPORARY_REDIRECT) are considered successful

methods.name: inputMessageParam
methods.description: (Only used when methodeType=POST and paramsInUrl=false) Name of the request parameter which is used to put the input message in

methods.name: maxConnections
methods.description: the maximum number of concurrent connections

methods.name: maxExecuteRetries
methods.description: the maximum number of times it the execution is retried

methods.name: methodType
methods.description: type of method to be executed, either 'GET', 'POST', 'PUT', 'DELETE', 'HEAD' or 'REPORT'

methods.name: multipart
methods.description: when true and methodetype=post and paramsinurl=false, request parameters are put in a multipart/form-data entity instead of in the request body

methods.name: multipartResponse
methods.description: when true the response body is expected to be in mime multipart which is the case when a soap message with attachments is received (see also https://docs.oracle.com/javaee/7/api/javax/xml/soap/soapmessage.html). the first part will be returned as result of this sender. other parts are returned as streams in sessionkeys with names multipart1, multipart2, etc. the http connection is held open until the last stream is read.

methods.name: multipartXmlSessionKey
methods.description: if set and methodetype=post and paramsinurl=false, a multipart/form-data entity is created instead of a request body. for each part element in the session key a part in the multipart entity is created

methods.name: name
methods.description: name of the sender

methods.name: namespaceDefs
methods.description: namespace defintions to be added in the soap envelope tag. must be in the form of a comma or space separated list of prefix=namespaceuri-definitions

methods.name: paramsInUrl
methods.description: When false and methodeType=POST, request parameters are put in the request body instead of in the url

methods.name: password
methods.description: password used in authentication to host

methods.name: postType
methods.description: When false and methodeType=POST the type of post request, must be one of [RAW (text/xml/json), BINARY (file), URLENCODED, FORMDATA, MTOM]

methods.name: protocol
methods.description: Secure socket protocol (such as 'SSL' and 'TLS') to use when a SSLContext object is generated. If empty the protocol 'SSL' is used

methods.name: proxyAuthAlias
methods.description: alias used to obtain credentials for authentication to proxy

methods.name: proxyHost
methods.description: proxy host

methods.name: proxyPassword
methods.description: proxy password

methods.name: proxyPort
methods.description: proxy port

methods.name: proxyRealm
methods.description: proxy realm

methods.name: proxyUserName
methods.description: proxy username

methods.name: resultStatusCodeSessionKey
methods.description: if set, the status code of the http response is put in specified in the sessionkey and the (error or okay) response message is returned

methods.name: serviceNamespace
methods.description: the namespace of the message sent. identifies the service to be called. may be overriden by an actual namespace setting in the message to be sent

methods.name: serviceNamespaceParam
methods.description: parameter to obtain the servicenamespace

methods.name: soap
methods.description: when true, messages sent are put in a soap envelope and the soap envelope is removed from received messages (soap envelope will not be visible to the pipeline)

methods.name: soapAction
methods.description: the soapactionuri to be set in the requestheader

methods.name: soapActionParam
methods.description: parameter to obtain the soapactionuri

methods.name: staleChecking
methods.description: controls whether connections checked to be stale, i.e. appear open, but are not.

methods.name: staleTimeout
methods.description: Used when StaleChecking=true. Timeout when stale connections should be closed.

methods.name: storeResultAsStreamInSessionKey
methods.description: if set, a pointer to an input stream of the result is put in the specified sessionkey (as the sender interface only allows a sender to return a string a sessionkey is used instead to return the stream)

methods.name: streamResultToFileNameSessionKey
methods.description: if set, the result is streamed to a file (instead of passed as a string)

methods.name: streamResultToServlet
methods.description: if set, the result is streamed to the httpservletresponse object of the restservicedispatcher (instead of passed as a string)

methods.name: styleSheetName
methods.description: >(only used when xhtml=true) stylesheet to apply to the html response

methods.name: throwApplicationFaults
methods.description: controls whether soap faults generated by the application generate an exception, or are treated as 'normal' messages

methods.name: timeout
methods.description: timeout in ms of obtaining a connection/result. 0 means no timeout

methods.name: truststore
methods.description: resource url to truststore to be used for authentication

methods.name: truststoreAuthAlias
methods.description: alias used to obtain truststore password

methods.name: truststorePassword
methods.description: truststore password

methods.name: truststoreType
methods.description: type of truststore

methods.name: url
methods.description: URL or base of URL to be used

methods.name: urlParam
methods.description: parameter that is used to obtain url; overrides url-attribute.

methods.name: userName
methods.description: username used in authentication to host

methods.name: verifyHostname
methods.description: when true, the hostname in the certificate will be checked against the actual hostname

methods.name: wssAuthAlias
methods.description: alias used to obtain credentials for authentication to web services security

methods.name: wssPasswordDigest
methods.description: when true, the password is sent digested. otherwise it is sent in clear text

methods.name: xhtml
methods.description: when true, the html response is transformed to xhtml

methods.name: authAlias
methods.description: alias used to obtain credentials for authentication to host

methods.name: contentType
methods.description: content-type of the request

methods.name: maxConnections
methods.description: the maximum number of concurrent connections

methods.description: the soapactionuri to be set in the requestheader

methods.name: timeout
methods.description: timeout in ms of obtaining a connection/result. 0 means no timeout

methods.name: url
methods.description: url or base of url to be used

methods.name: userName
methods.description: username used in authentication to host

methods.name: authAlias
methods.description: name of the alias to obtain credentials to authenticatie on remote server

methods.name: carriageflag
methods.description: one of yes, no, vrl, vrl2, mpack or xpack

methods.name: codeflag
methods.description: characterset conversion, one of ascii or ebcdic

methods.name: compress
methods.description: one of yes, no, rle, compact, lzlarge, lzmedium or lzsmall

methods.name: fileOption
methods.description: one of create, append or replace

methods.name: logfile
methods.description: name of logfile for xcomtcp to be used

methods.name: name
methods.description: name of the sender

methods.name: password
methods.description: password of user on remote system

methods.name: port
methods.description: port of remote host

methods.name: queue
methods.description: set queue off or on

methods.name: remoteDirectory
methods.description: remote directory is prefixed witht the remote file

methods.name: remoteFilePattern
methods.description: remote file to create. if empty, the name is equal to the local file

methods.name: remoteSystem
methods.description: hostname or tcpip adres of remote host

methods.name: tracelevel
methods.description: set between 0 (no trace) and 10

methods.name: truncation
methods.description: set truncation off or on

methods.name: userid
methods.description: loginname of user on remote system

methods.name: workingDirName
methods.description: directory in which to run the xcomtcp command

methods.name: xcomtcp
methods.description: path to xcomtcp command

methods.name: name
methods.description: name of the sender

methods.name: name
methods.description: name of the sender

methods.name: authAlias
methods.description: Authentication alias used to authenticate when connecting to database

methods.name: authentication
methods.description: maps to the field context.security_authentication

methods.name: avoidLocking
methods.description: If true, then select queries are executed in a way that avoids taking locks, e.g. with isolation mode 'read committed' instead of 'repeatable read'.

methods.name: blobBase64Direction
methods.description: controls whether the streamed blobdata will need to be base64 encode or decode or not.

methods.name: blobCharset
methods.description: Charset that is used to read and write BLOBs. This assumes the blob contains character data. If blobCharset and blobSessionKey are not set, blobs are base64 encoded after being read to accommodate for the fact that senders need to return a String

methods.name: blobColumn
methods.description: Only for querytype 'updateBlob': column that contains the BLOB to be updated

methods.name: blobSessionKey
methods.description:
For querytype 'updateBlob': key of session variable that contains the data (String or InputStream) to be loaded to the BLOB. When empty, the input of the pipe, which then must be a String, is used.
For querytype 'select': key of session variable that contains the OutputStream, Writer or Filename to write the BLOB to

methods.name: blobSmartGet
methods.description: Controls automatically whether blobdata is stored compressed and/or serialized in the database

methods.name: blobsCompressed
methods.description: controls whether blobdata is stored compressed in the database

methods.name: clobColumn
methods.description: Only for querytype 'updateClob': column that contains the CLOB to be updated

methods.name: clobSessionKey
methods.description:
For querytype 'updateClob': key of session variable that contains the CLOB (String or InputStream) to be loaded to the CLOB. When empty, the input of the pipe, which then must be a String, is used.
For querytype 'select': key of session variable that contains the OutputStream, Writer or Filename to write the CLOB to

methods.name: closeInputstreamOnExit
methods.description: When set to false, the Inputstream is not closed after it has been used to read a BLOB or CLOB

methods.name: closeOutputstreamOnExit
methods.description: When set to false, the Outputstream is not closed after BLOB or CLOB has been written to it

methods.name: columnsReturned
methods.description: Comma separated list of columns whose values are to be returned. Works only if the driver implements jdbc 3.0 getGeneratedKeys()

methods.name: credentials
methods.description: username to connect to context, maps to context.security_credentials

methods.name: datasourceName
methods.description: JNDI name of datasource to be used, can be configured via jmsRealm, too

methods.name: includeFieldDefinition
methods.description: when true, the result contains besides the returned rows also a header with information about the fetched fields

methods.name: initialContextFactoryName
methods.description: class to use as initial context factory

methods.name: jndiAuthAlias
methods.description: authentication alias, may be used to override principal and credential-settings

methods.name: lockRows
methods.description: When set true, exclusive row-level locks are obtained on all the rows identified by the select statement (e.g. by appending ' FOR UPDATE NOWAIT SKIP LOCKED' to the end of the query)

methods.name: lockWait
methods.description: when set and >=0, ' FOR UPDATE WAIT #' is used instead of ' FOR UPDATE NOWAIT SKIP LOCKED'

methods.name: maxRows
methods.description: The maximum number of rows to be returned from the output of select queries

methods.name: name
methods.description: Name of the sender

methods.name: nullValue
methods.description: Value used in result as contents of fields that contain no value (sql-null)

methods.name: password
methods.description: Password for authentication when connecting to database, when none found from authAlias

methods.name: principal
methods.description: username to connect to context, maps to context.security_principal

methods.name: queryType
methods.description:
One of:
  • select for queries that return data
  • updateBlob for queries that update a BLOB
  • updateClob for queries that update a CLOB
  • package to execute Oracle PL/SQL package
  • other or anything else for queries that return no data.

methods.name: resultQuery
methods.description: Query that can be used to obtain result of side-effect of update-query, like generated value of sequence. Example: SELECT mysequence.currval FROM dual

methods.name: rowIdSessionKey
methods.description: If specified, the rowid of the processed row is put in the pipelinesession under the specified key (only applicable for querytype=other). Note: If multiple rows are processed a SqlException is thrown.

methods.name: scalar
methods.description: When true, the value of the first column of the first row (or the startrow) is returned as the only result, as a simple non-xml value

methods.name: scalarExtended
methods.description:
When true and scalar is also true, but returns no value, one of the following is returned:
  • '[absent]' no row is found
  • '[null]' a row is found, but the value is a SQL-NULL
  • '[empty]' a row is found, but the value is a empty string

methods.name: securityProtocol
methods.description: maps to the field context.security_protocol

methods.name: sqlDialect
methods.description: If set, the SQL dialect in which the queries are written and should be translated from to the actual SQL dialect

methods.name: startRow
methods.description: The number of the first row to be returned from the output of select queries. Rows before this are skipped from the output.

methods.name: streamCharset
methods.description: Charset used when reading a stream (that is e.g. going to be written to a BLOB or CLOB). When empty, the stream is copied directly to the BLOB, without conversion

methods.name: streamResultToServlet
methods.description: If set, the result is streamed to the HttpServletResponse object of the RestServiceDispatcher (instead of passed as a String)

methods.name: timeout
methods.description: The number of seconds the driver will wait for a statement object to execute. If the limit is exceeded, a TimeoutException is thrown. A value of 0 means execution time is not limited

methods.name: trimSpaces
methods.description: Remove trailing blanks from all result values.

methods.name: urlPkgPrefixes
methods.description: maps to the field context.url_pkg_prefixes

methods.name: useNamedParams
methods.description: When true, every string in the message which equals ?{paramname+UNP_END+ will be replaced by the setter method for the corresponding parameter. The parameters don't need to be in the correct order and unused parameters are skipped.

methods.name: username
methods.description: User name for authentication when connecting to database, when none found from authAlias

methods.name: addNamespaceToSchema
methods.description: If set true, the namespace from schemalocation is added to the schema document as targetnamespace

methods.name: charset
methods.description: Characterset used for reading file, only used when validateFile is true

methods.name: fullSchemaChecking
methods.description: Perform addional memory intensive checks

methods.name: ignoreCaching
methods.description: If set true, the number for caching validators in appConstants is ignored and no caching is done (for this validator only)

methods.name: importedNamespacesToIgnore
methods.description: Comma separated list of namespaces which are excluded from an import or include in the schema document

methods.name: importedSchemaLocationsToIgnore
methods.description: Comma separated list of schemaLocations which are excluded from an import or include in the schema document

methods.name: lazyInit
methods.description: If set, the value in appconstants is overwritten (for this validator only)

methods.name: reasonSessionKey
methods.description: If set: key of session variable to store reasons of mis-validation in

methods.name: throwException
methods.description: Should the XmlValidator throw a PipeRunexception on a validation error. If not, a forward with name 'failure' must be defined.

methods.name: useBaseImportedSchemaLocationsToIgnore
methods.description: If set true, the comparison for importedSchemaLocationsToIgnore is done on base filename without any path

methods.name: validateFile
methods.description: If set true, the input is assumed to be the name of the file to be validated. Otherwise the input itself is validated

methods.name: warn
methods.description: If set true, send warnings to logging and console about syntax problems in the configured schema('s)

methods.name: xmlReasonSessionKey
methods.description: Like reasonSessionKey but stores reasons in xml format and more extensive

methods.name: xmlSchemaVersion
methods.description: If set to 1.0, Xerces's previous XML Schema factory will be used, which would make all XSD 1.1 features illegal. The default behaviour can also be set with xsd.processor.version property.

methods.defaultValue: false, if not set in stylesheet
methods.name: indentXml
methods.description: when set true, result is pretty-printed. When not set, the value specified in the stylesheet is followed

methods.name: name
methods.description: name of the sender

methods.name: namespaceDefs
methods.description: Namespace defintions for xpathExpression. Must be in the form of a comma or space separated list of prefix=namespaceuri-definitions. For some use other cases (NOT xpathExpression), one entry can be without a prefix, that will define the default namespace.

methods.defaultValue: false, if not set in stylesheet
methods.name: omitXmlDeclaration
methods.description: omit the xml declaration on top of the output. When not set, the value specified in the stylesheet is followed

methods.name: outputType
methods.description: For xpathExpression only: either 'text' or 'xml'.

methods.name: removeNamespaces
methods.description: when set true namespaces (and prefixes) in the input message are removed before transformation

methods.name: skipEmptyTags
methods.description: when set true empty tags in the output are removed after transformation

methods.name: styleSheetCacheSize
methods.description: Size of cache of stylesheets retrieved from styleSheetNameSessionKey

methods.name: styleSheetName
methods.description: Location of stylesheet to apply to the input message

methods.name: styleSheetNameSessionKey
methods.description: Session key to retrieve stylesheet location. Overrides stylesheetName or xpathExpression attribute

methods.name: xpathExpression
methods.description: Alternatively: xpath-expression to create stylesheet from

methods.name: xslt2
methods.description: when set true xslt processor 2.0 (net.sf.saxon) will be used, otherwise xslt processor 1.0 (org.apache.xalan)

methods.name: xsltVersion
methods.description: when set to 2 xslt processor 2.0 (net.sf.saxon) will be used, otherwise xslt processor 1.0 (org.apache.xalan). 0 will auto detect

methods.name: charset
methods.description: characterset used for writing zip entry

methods.name: closeInputstreamOnExit
methods.description: when set to false, the inputstream is not closed after it has been used

methods.name: name
methods.description: name of the sender

methods.name: zipWriterHandle
methods.description: session key used to refer to zip session. must be used if zipwriterpipes are nested

methods.name: acceptNamespaceLessXml
methods.description: If true, all xml is allowed to be without namespaces. If no namespaces are detected (by the presence of the string 'xmlns') in the xml string, the root namespace is added to the xml

methods.name: active
methods.description: controls whether pipe is included in configuration. when set false or set to something else as true, (even set to the empty string), the pipe is not included in the configuration

methods.name: addNamespaceToSchema
methods.description: If set true, the namespace from schemalocation is added to the schema document as targetnamespace

methods.name: allowPlainXml
methods.description: allow plain xml, without a SOAP Envelope, too

methods.name: autoFormat
methods.description: If true, the format on 'output' is set to the same as the format of the input message on 'input'. The format of the input message is stored in and retrieved from the session variable specified by outputFormatSessionKey

methods.name: charset
methods.description: Characterset used for reading file, only used when validateFile is true

methods.name: chompCharSize
methods.description: If set (>=0) and the character data length inside a xml element exceeds this size, the character data is chomped (with a clear comment)

methods.name: compactJsonArrays
methods.description: If true assume arrays in json do not have the element containers like in xml

methods.name: deepSearch
methods.description: If true, and converting from json to xml, parameter substitutions are searched for optional sub elements too. By default, only mandatory elements are searched for parameter substitutions. N.B. Currenlty this option might cause problems. Please try using more qualified parameters names (using '/') first

methods.defaultValue: If durationThreshold >=0 and the duration of the message processing exceeded the value specified (in milliseconds) the message is logged informatory
methods.name: durationThreshold
elementToMove
methods.description: If set, the character data in this element is stored under a session key and in the message replaced by a reference to this session key: {sessionkey: + elementToMoveSessionKey + }

methods.name: elementToMoveChain
methods.description: Like elementToMove but element is preceded with all ancestor elements and separated by semicolons (e.g. 'adapter;pipeline;pipe')

methods.defaultValue: ref_ + the name of the element
methods.name: elementToMoveSessionKey
methods.description: (Only used when elementToMove is set) Name of the session key under which the character data is stored

methods.name: emptyInputReplacement
methods.description: If set and the input is empty, this fixed value is taken as input

methods.name: failOnWildcards
methods.description: If true, an exception is thrown when a wildcard is found in the xml schema when parsing an object. This often indicates that an element is not properly typed in the xml schema, and could lead to ambuigities.

methods.name: forwardFailureToSuccess
methods.description: If set true, the failure forward is replaced by the success forward (like a warning mode)

methods.name: forwardName
methods.description: Sets the name of the forward that is looked up upon completion.

methods.name: fullSchemaChecking
methods.description: Perform addional memory intensive checks

methods.name: getInputFromFixedValue
methods.description: If set, this fixed value is taken as input, instead of regular input

methods.name: getInputFromSessionKey
methods.description: If set, input is taken from this session key, instead of regular input

methods.name: hideRegex
methods.description: Regular expression to mask strings in the log. For example, the regular expression (?<=<password>).*?(?=</password>) will replace every character between keys '<password>' and '</password>'. note: this feature is used at adapter level, so one pipe affects all pipes in the pipeline (and multiple values in different pipes are merged)

methods.name: ifParam
methods.description: when set, this pipe is only executed when the value of parameter with name ifparam equals ifvalue (otherwise this pipe is skipped)

methods.name: ifValue
methods.description: see ifparam

methods.name: ignoreCaching
methods.description: If set true, the number for caching validators in appConstants is ignored and no caching is done (for this validator only)

methods.name: importedNamespacesToIgnore
methods.description: Comma separated list of namespaces which are excluded from an import or include in the schema document

methods.name: importedSchemaLocationsToIgnore
methods.description: Comma separated list of schemaLocations which are excluded from an import or include in the schema document

methods.name: inputFormatSessionKey
methods.description: Session key to store the inputformat in, to be able to set the outputformat when autoForamat=true.

methods.name: jsonWithRootElements
methods.description: If true, assume that json contains/must contain a root element

methods.name: lazyInit
methods.description: If set, the value in appconstants is overwritten (for this validator only)

methods.name: maxThreads
methods.description: maximum number of threads that may call {@link #doPipe(java.lang.Object, nl.nn.adapterframework.core.IPipeLineSession)} simultaneously

methods.name: name
methods.description: name of the pipe

methods.name: namespaceAware
methods.description: controls namespace-awareness of possible xml parsing in descender-classes

methods.name: noNamespaceSchemaLocation
methods.description: A uri reference as a hint as to the location of a schema document with no target namespace.

methods.name: outputFormat
methods.description: Default format of the result. Either 'xml' or 'json'

methods.name: outputFormatSessionKey
methods.description: Session key to retrieve outputformat from.

methods.name: outputSoapBody
methods.description: identical to the soapbody attribute except that it's used for the output message instead of the input message. for more information see note 1

methods.name: preserveInput
methods.description: If set true, the result of the pipe is replaced with the original input (i.e. the input before configured replacements of getInputFromSessionKey, getInputFromFixedValue or emptyInputReplacement)

methods.name: produceNamespaceLessXml
methods.description: If true, all xml that is generated is without a namespace set

methods.name: reasonSessionKey
methods.description: If set: key of session variable to store reasons of mis-validation in

methods.name: responseRoot
methods.description: Name of the response root element, or a comma separated list of names to choose from (only one is allowed)

methods.defaultValue: If set true, compacted messages in the result are restored to their original format (see also {@link #setElementToMove(java.lang.String)})
methods.name: restoreMovedElements
root
methods.description: always envelope (not allowed to change)

methods.name: rootElementSessionKey
methods.description: key of session variable to store the name of the root element

methods.name: rootNamespaceSessionKey
methods.description: key of session variable to store the namespace of the root element

methods.name: schema
methods.description: the filename of the schema on the classpath. see doc on the method. (effectively the same as noNamespaceSchemaLocation)

methods.name: schemaLocation
methods.description: Pairs of uri references (one for the namespace name, and one for a hint as to the location of a schema document defining names for that namespace name). see doc on the method.

methods.name: schemaLocationToAdd
methods.description: pairs of uri references which will be added to the wsdl

methods.name: schemaSessionKey
methods.description: session key for retrieving a schema

methods.defaultValue: (Only used when writetoseclog=true) Comma separated list of keys of session variables that is appended to the security log record
methods.name: secLogSessionKeys
skipOnEmptyInput
methods.description: when set, the processing continues directly at the forward of this pipe, without executing the pipe itself

methods.name: soapBody
methods.description: name of the child element of the soap body. or a comma separated list of names to choose from (only one is allowed) (wsdl generator will use the first element) (use empty value to allow an empty soap body, for example to allow element x and an empty soap body use: x,)

methods.name: soapBodyNamespace
methods.description: creates schemalocation attribute based on the wsdl and replaces the namespace of the soap body element

methods.name: soapHeader
methods.description: name of the child element of the soap header. or a comma separated list of names to choose from (only one is allowed) (wsdl generator will use the first element) (use empty value to allow an empty soap header, for example to allow element x and an empty soap header use: x,)

methods.name: soapHeaderNamespace
methods.description: can be used when the soap header element exists multiple times

methods.name: soapNamespace
methods.description: The namespace of the SOAP envelope, when this property has a value and the input message is a SOAP message, the content of the SOAP Body is used for validation, hence the SOAP Envelope and SOAP Body elements are not considered part of the message to validate. Please note that this functionality is deprecated, using {@link nl.nn.adapterframework.soap.SoapValidator} is now the preferred solution in case a SOAP message needs to be validated, in other cases give this property an empty value

methods.name: soapVersion
methods.description: soap envelope xsd version to use: 1.1, 1.2 or any (both 1.1 and 1.2)

methods.name: storeResultInSessionKey
methods.description: If set, the result (before replacing when true) is stored under this session key

methods.name: strictJsonArraySyntax
methods.description: If true check that incoming json adheres to the specified syntax (compact or full), otherwise both types are accepted for conversion from json to xml

methods.name: targetNamespace
methods.description: Only for json input: namespace of the resulting xml. Need only be specified when the namespace of root name is ambiguous in the schema

methods.name: throwException
methods.description: Should the XmlValidator throw a PipeRunexception on a validation error. If not, a forward with name 'failure' must be defined.

methods.name: transactionAttribute
methods.description:
Defines transaction and isolation behaviour.For developers: it is equalto EJB transaction attribute.Possible values are:
transactionAttributecallers TransactionPipeline excecuted in Transaction
Required noneT2
T1 T1
RequiresNew noneT2
T1 T2
Mandatory noneerror
T1 T1
NotSupportednonenone
T1 none
Supports nonenone
T1 T1
Never nonenone
T1 error

methods.name: transactionAttributeNum
methods.description:
Like transactionAttribute, but the chosen option is represented with a number. The numbers mean:
0Required
1Supports
2Mandatory
3RequiresNew
4NotSupported
5Never

methods.name: schemaLocation
methods.description: Pairs of uri references (one for the namespace name, and one for a hint as to the location of a schema document defining names for that namespace name). see doc on the method.

methods.name: schemaSessionKey
methods.description: session key for retrieving a schema

methods.defaultValue: (Only used when writetoseclog=true) Comma separated list of keys of session variables that is appended to the security log record
methods.name: secLogSessionKeys
skipOnEmptyInput
methods.description: when set, the processing continues directly at the forward of this pipe, without executing the pipe itself

methods.name: soapBody
methods.description: name of the child element of the soap body. or a comma separated list of names to choose from (only one is allowed) (wsdl generator will use the first element) (use empty value to allow an empty soap body, for example to allow element x and an empty soap body use: x,)

methods.name: soapHeader
methods.description: name of the child element of the soap header. or a comma separated list of names to choose from (only one is allowed) (wsdl generator will use the first element) (use empty value to allow an empty soap header, for example to allow element x and an empty soap header use: x,)

methods.name: soapHeaderNamespace
methods.description: can be used when the soap header element exists multiple times

methods.name: soapNamespace
methods.description: The namespace of the SOAP envelope, when this property has a value and the input message is a SOAP message, the content of the SOAP Body is used for validation, hence the SOAP Envelope and SOAP Body elements are not considered part of the message to validate. Please note that this functionality is deprecated, using {@link nl.nn.adapterframework.soap.SoapValidator} is now the preferred solution in case a SOAP message needs to be validated, in other cases give this property an empty value

methods.name: soapVersion
methods.description: soap envelope xsd version to use: 1.1, 1.2 or any (both 1.1 and 1.2)

methods.name: storeResultInSessionKey
methods.description: If set, the result (before replacing when true) is stored under this session key

methods.name: strictJsonArraySyntax
methods.description: If true check that incoming json adheres to the specified syntax (compact or full), otherwise both types are accepted for conversion from json to xml

methods.name: targetNamespace
methods.description: Only for json input: namespace of the resulting xml. Need only be specified when the namespace of root name is ambiguous in the schema

methods.name: throwException
methods.description: Should the XmlValidator throw a PipeRunexception on a validation error. If not, a forward with name 'failure' must be defined.

methods.name: transactionAttribute
methods.description:
Defines transaction and isolation behaviour.For developers: it is equalto EJB transaction attribute.Possible values are:
transactionAttributecallers TransactionPipeline excecuted in Transaction
Required noneT2
T1 T1
RequiresNew noneT2
T1 T2
Mandatory noneerror
T1 T1
NotSupportednonenone
T1 none
Supports nonenone
T1 T1
Never nonenone
T1 error

methods.name: transactionAttributeNum
methods.description:
Like transactionAttribute, but the chosen option is represented with a number. The numbers mean:
0Required
1Supports
2Mandatory
3RequiresNew
4NotSupported
5Never

methods.name: transactionTimeout
methods.description: timeout (in seconds) of transaction started to process a message.

methods.name: useBaseImportedSchemaLocationsToIgnore
methods.description: If set true, the comparison for importedSchemaLocationsToIgnore is done on base filename without any path

methods.name: validateFile
methods.description: If set true, the input is assumed to be the name of the file to be validated. Otherwise the input itself is validated

methods.name: validateJsonToRootElementOnly
methods.description: If true, and converting to or from json, then the message root is the only rootValidation, ignoring root validations like for SOAP envelope and header set by descender classes like SoapValidator

methods.name: warn
methods.description: If set true, send warnings to logging and console about syntax problems in the configured schema('s)

methods.name: xmlReasonSessionKey
methods.description: Like reasonSessionKey but stores reasons in xml format and more extensive

methods.name: xmlSchemaVersion
methods.description: If set to 1.0, Xerces's previous XML Schema factory will be used, which would make all XSD 1.1 features illegal. The default behaviour can also be set with xsd.processor.version property.

methods.name: acceptNamespaceLessXml
methods.description: If true, all xml is allowed to be without namespaces. If no namespaces are detected (by the presence of the string 'xmlns') in the xml string, the root namespace is added to the xml

methods.name: active
methods.description: controls whether pipe is included in configuration. when set false or set to something else as true, (even set to the empty string), the pipe is not included in the configuration

methods.name: addNamespaceToSchema
methods.description: If set true, the namespace from schemalocation is added to the schema document as targetnamespace

methods.name: allowPlainXml
methods.description: allow plain xml, without a SOAP Envelope, too

methods.name: autoFormat
methods.description: If true, the format on 'output' is set to the same as the format of the input message on 'input'. The format of the input message is stored in and retrieved from the session variable specified by outputFormatSessionKey

methods.name: charset
methods.description: Characterset used for reading file, only used when validateFile is true

methods.name: chompCharSize
methods.description: If set (>=0) and the character data length inside a xml element exceeds this size, the character data is chomped (with a clear comment)

methods.name: compactJsonArrays
methods.description: If true assume arrays in json do not have the element containers like in xml

methods.name: deepSearch
methods.description: If true, and converting from json to xml, parameter substitutions are searched for optional sub elements too. By default, only mandatory elements are searched for parameter substitutions. N.B. Currenlty this option might cause problems. Please try using more qualified parameters names (using '/') first

methods.defaultValue: If durationThreshold >=0 and the duration of the message processing exceeded the value specified (in milliseconds) the message is logged informatory
methods.name: durationThreshold
elementToMove
methods.description: If set, the character data in this element is stored under a session key and in the message replaced by a reference to this session key: {sessionkey: + elementToMoveSessionKey + }

methods.name: elementToMoveChain
methods.description: Like elementToMove but element is preceded with all ancestor elements and separated by semicolons (e.g. 'adapter;pipeline;pipe')

methods.defaultValue: ref_ + the name of the element
methods.name: elementToMoveSessionKey
methods.description: (Only used when elementToMove is set) Name of the session key under which the character data is stored

methods.name: emptyInputReplacement
methods.description: If set and the input is empty, this fixed value is taken as input

methods.name: failOnWildcards
methods.description: If true, an exception is thrown when a wildcard is found in the xml schema when parsing an object. This often indicates that an element is not properly typed in the xml schema, and could lead to ambuigities.

methods.name: forwardFailureToSuccess
methods.description: If set true, the failure forward is replaced by the success forward (like a warning mode)

methods.name: forwardName
methods.description: Sets the name of the forward that is looked up upon completion.

methods.name: fullSchemaChecking
methods.description: Perform addional memory intensive checks

methods.name: getInputFromFixedValue
methods.description: If set, this fixed value is taken as input, instead of regular input

methods.name: getInputFromSessionKey
methods.description: If set, input is taken from this session key, instead of regular input

methods.name: hideRegex
methods.description: Regular expression to mask strings in the log. For example, the regular expression (?<=<password>).*?(?=</password>) will replace every character between keys '<password>' and '</password>'. note: this feature is used at adapter level, so one pipe affects all pipes in the pipeline (and multiple values in different pipes are merged)

methods.name: ifParam
methods.description: when set, this pipe is only executed when the value of parameter with name ifparam equals ifvalue (otherwise this pipe is skipped)

methods.name: ifValue
methods.description: see ifparam

methods.name: ignoreCaching
methods.description: If set true, the number for caching validators in appConstants is ignored and no caching is done (for this validator only)

methods.name: importedNamespacesToIgnore
methods.description: Comma separated list of namespaces which are excluded from an import or include in the schema document

methods.name: importedSchemaLocationsToIgnore
methods.description: Comma separated list of schemaLocations which are excluded from an import or include in the schema document

methods.name: inputFormatSessionKey
methods.description: Session key to store the inputformat in, to be able to set the outputformat when autoForamat=true.

methods.name: jsonWithRootElements
methods.description: If true, assume that json contains/must contain a root element

methods.name: lazyInit
methods.description: If set, the value in appconstants is overwritten (for this validator only)

methods.name: maxThreads
methods.description: maximum number of threads that may call {@link #doPipe(java.lang.Object, nl.nn.adapterframework.core.IPipeLineSession)} simultaneously

methods.name: name
methods.description: name of the pipe

methods.name: namespaceAware
methods.description: controls namespace-awareness of possible xml parsing in descender-classes

methods.name: noNamespaceSchemaLocation
methods.description: A uri reference as a hint as to the location of a schema document with no target namespace.

methods.name: outputFormat
methods.description: Default format of the result. Either 'xml' or 'json'

methods.name: outputFormatSessionKey
methods.description: Session key to retrieve outputformat from.

methods.name: outputSoapBody
methods.description: identical to the soapbody attribute except that it's used for the output message instead of the input message. for more information see note 1

methods.name: preserveInput
methods.description: If set true, the result of the pipe is replaced with the original input (i.e. the input before configured replacements of getInputFromSessionKey, getInputFromFixedValue or emptyInputReplacement)

methods.name: produceNamespaceLessXml
methods.description: If true, all xml that is generated is without a namespace set

methods.name: reasonSessionKey
methods.description: If set: key of session variable to store reasons of mis-validation in

methods.name: responseRoot
methods.description: Name of the response root element, or a comma separated list of names to choose from (only one is allowed)

methods.defaultValue: If set true, compacted messages in the result are restored to their original format (see also {@link #setElementToMove(java.lang.String)})
methods.name: restoreMovedElements
root
methods.description: always envelope (not allowed to change)

methods.name: rootElementSessionKey
methods.description: key of session variable to store the name of the root element

methods.name: rootNamespaceSessionKey
methods.description: key of session variable to store the namespace of the root element

methods.description: identical to the soapbody attribute except that it's used for the output message instead of the input message. for more information see note 1

methods.name: preserveInput
methods.description: If set true, the result of the pipe is replaced with the original input (i.e. the input before configured replacements of getInputFromSessionKey, getInputFromFixedValue or emptyInputReplacement)

methods.name: produceNamespaceLessXml
methods.description: If true, all xml that is generated is without a namespace set

methods.name: reasonSessionKey
methods.description: If set: key of session variable to store reasons of mis-validation in

methods.name: responseRoot
methods.description: Name of the response root element, or a comma separated list of names to choose from (only one is allowed)

methods.defaultValue: If set true, compacted messages in the result are restored to their original format (see also {@link #setElementToMove(java.lang.String)})
methods.name: restoreMovedElements
root
methods.description: always envelope (not allowed to change)

methods.name: rootElementSessionKey
methods.description: key of session variable to store the name of the root element

methods.name: rootNamespaceSessionKey
methods.description: key of session variable to store the namespace of the root element

methods.name: schema
methods.description: the filename of the schema on the classpath. see doc on the method. (effectively the same as noNamespaceSchemaLocation)

methods.name: schemaLocation
methods.description: Pairs of uri references (one for the namespace name, and one for a hint as to the location of a schema document defining names for that namespace name). see doc on the method.

methods.name: schemaSessionKey
methods.description: session key for retrieving a schema

methods.defaultValue: (Only used when writetoseclog=true) Comma separated list of keys of session variables that is appended to the security log record
methods.name: secLogSessionKeys
skipOnEmptyInput
methods.description: when set, the processing continues directly at the forward of this pipe, without executing the pipe itself

methods.name: soapBody
methods.description: name of the child element of the soap body. or a comma separated list of names to choose from (only one is allowed) (wsdl generator will use the first element) (use empty value to allow an empty soap body, for example to allow element x and an empty soap body use: x,)

methods.name: soapHeader
methods.description: name of the child element of the soap header. or a comma separated list of names to choose from (only one is allowed) (wsdl generator will use the first element) (use empty value to allow an empty soap header, for example to allow element x and an empty soap header use: x,)

methods.name: soapHeaderNamespace
methods.description: can be used when the soap header element exists multiple times

methods.name: soapNamespace
methods.description: The namespace of the SOAP envelope, when this property has a value and the input message is a SOAP message, the content of the SOAP Body is used for validation, hence the SOAP Envelope and SOAP Body elements are not considered part of the message to validate. Please note that this functionality is deprecated, using {@link nl.nn.adapterframework.soap.SoapValidator} is now the preferred solution in case a SOAP message needs to be validated, in other cases give this property an empty value

methods.name: soapVersion
methods.description: soap envelope xsd version to use: 1.1, 1.2 or any (both 1.1 and 1.2)

methods.name: storeResultInSessionKey
methods.description: If set, the result (before replacing when true) is stored under this session key

methods.name: strictJsonArraySyntax
methods.description: If true check that incoming json adheres to the specified syntax (compact or full), otherwise both types are accepted for conversion from json to xml

methods.name: targetNamespace
methods.description: Only for json input: namespace of the resulting xml. Need only be specified when the namespace of root name is ambiguous in the schema

methods.name: throwException
methods.description: Should the XmlValidator throw a PipeRunexception on a validation error. If not, a forward with name 'failure' must be defined.

methods.name: transactionAttribute
methods.description:
Defines transaction and isolation behaviour.For developers: it is equalto EJB transaction attribute.Possible values are:
transactionAttributecallers TransactionPipeline excecuted in Transaction
Required noneT2
T1 T1
RequiresNew noneT2
T1 T2
Mandatory noneerror
T1 T1
NotSupportednonenone
T1 none
Supports nonenone
T1 T1
Never nonenone
T1 error

methods.name: transactionAttributeNum
methods.description:
Like transactionAttribute, but the chosen option is represented with a number. The numbers mean:
0Required
1Supports
2Mandatory
3RequiresNew
4NotSupported
5Never

methods.name: transactionTimeout
methods.description: timeout (in seconds) of transaction started to process a message.

methods.name: useBaseImportedSchemaLocationsToIgnore
methods.description: If set true, the comparison for importedSchemaLocationsToIgnore is done on base filename without any path

methods.name: validateFile
methods.description: If set true, the input is assumed to be the name of the file to be validated. Otherwise the input itself is validated

methods.name: validateJsonToRootElementOnly
methods.description: If true, and converting to or from json, then the message root is the only rootValidation, ignoring root validations like for SOAP envelope and header set by descender classes like SoapValidator

methods.name: warn
methods.description: If set true, send warnings to logging and console about syntax problems in the configured schema('s)

methods.name: xmlReasonSessionKey
methods.description: Like reasonSessionKey but stores reasons in xml format and more extensive

methods.name: xmlSchemaVersion
methods.description: If set to 1.0, Xerces's previous XML Schema factory will be used, which would make all XSD 1.1 features illegal. The default behaviour can also be set with xsd.processor.version property.

methods.name: acceptNamespaceLessXml
methods.description: If true, all xml is allowed to be without namespaces. If no namespaces are detected (by the presence of the string 'xmlns') in the xml string, the root namespace is added to the xml

methods.name: active
methods.description: controls whether pipe is included in configuration. when set false or set to something else as true, (even set to the empty string), the pipe is not included in the configuration

methods.name: addNamespaceToSchema
methods.description: If set true, the namespace from schemalocation is added to the schema document as targetnamespace

methods.name: allowPlainXml
methods.description: allow plain xml, without a SOAP Envelope, too

methods.name: autoFormat
methods.description: If true, the format on 'output' is set to the same as the format of the input message on 'input'. The format of the input message is stored in and retrieved from the session variable specified by outputFormatSessionKey

methods.name: charset
methods.description: Characterset used for reading file, only used when validateFile is true

methods.name: chompCharSize
methods.description: If set (>=0) and the character data length inside a xml element exceeds this size, the character data is chomped (with a clear comment)

methods.name: compactJsonArrays
methods.description: If true assume arrays in json do not have the element containers like in xml

methods.name: deepSearch
methods.description: If true, and converting from json to xml, parameter substitutions are searched for optional sub elements too. By default, only mandatory elements are searched for parameter substitutions. N.B. Currenlty this option might cause problems. Please try using more qualified parameters names (using '/') first

methods.defaultValue: If durationThreshold >=0 and the duration of the message processing exceeded the value specified (in milliseconds) the message is logged informatory
methods.name: durationThreshold
elementToMove
methods.description: If set, the character data in this element is stored under a session key and in the message replaced by a reference to this session key: {sessionkey: + elementToMoveSessionKey + }

methods.name: elementToMoveChain
methods.description: Like elementToMove but element is preceded with all ancestor elements and separated by semicolons (e.g. 'adapter;pipeline;pipe')

methods.defaultValue: ref_ + the name of the element
methods.name: elementToMoveSessionKey
methods.description: (Only used when elementToMove is set) Name of the session key under which the character data is stored

methods.name: emptyInputReplacement
methods.description: If set and the input is empty, this fixed value is taken as input

methods.name: failOnWildcards
methods.description: If true, an exception is thrown when a wildcard is found in the xml schema when parsing an object. This often indicates that an element is not properly typed in the xml schema, and could lead to ambuigities.

methods.name: forwardFailureToSuccess
methods.description: If set true, the failure forward is replaced by the success forward (like a warning mode)

methods.name: forwardName
methods.description: Sets the name of the forward that is looked up upon completion.

methods.name: fullSchemaChecking
methods.description: Perform addional memory intensive checks

methods.name: getInputFromFixedValue
methods.description: If set, this fixed value is taken as input, instead of regular input

methods.name: getInputFromSessionKey
methods.description: If set, input is taken from this session key, instead of regular input

methods.name: hideRegex
methods.description: Regular expression to mask strings in the log. For example, the regular expression (?<=<password>).*?(?=</password>) will replace every character between keys '<password>' and '</password>'. note: this feature is used at adapter level, so one pipe affects all pipes in the pipeline (and multiple values in different pipes are merged)

methods.name: ifParam
methods.description: when set, this pipe is only executed when the value of parameter with name ifparam equals ifvalue (otherwise this pipe is skipped)

methods.name: ifValue
methods.description: see ifparam

methods.name: ignoreCaching
methods.description: If set true, the number for caching validators in appConstants is ignored and no caching is done (for this validator only)

methods.name: importedNamespacesToIgnore
methods.description: Comma separated list of namespaces which are excluded from an import or include in the schema document

methods.name: importedSchemaLocationsToIgnore
methods.description: Comma separated list of schemaLocations which are excluded from an import or include in the schema document

methods.name: inputFormatSessionKey
methods.description: Session key to store the inputformat in, to be able to set the outputformat when autoForamat=true.

methods.name: jsonWithRootElements
methods.description: If true, assume that json contains/must contain a root element

methods.name: lazyInit
methods.description: If set, the value in appconstants is overwritten (for this validator only)

methods.name: maxThreads
methods.description: maximum number of threads that may call {@link #doPipe(java.lang.Object, nl.nn.adapterframework.core.IPipeLineSession)} simultaneously

methods.name: name
methods.description: name of the pipe

methods.name: namespaceAware
methods.description: controls namespace-awareness of possible xml parsing in descender-classes

methods.name: noNamespaceSchemaLocation
methods.description: A uri reference as a hint as to the location of a schema document with no target namespace.

methods.name: outputFormat
methods.description: Default format of the result. Either 'xml' or 'json'

methods.name: outputFormatSessionKey
methods.description: Session key to retrieve outputformat from.
