methods.name: rootElementSessionKey
methods.description: key of session variable to store the name of the root element

methods.name: rootNamespaceSessionKey
methods.description: key of session variable to store the namespace of the root element

methods.name: schema
methods.description: the filename of the schema on the classpath. see doc on the method. (effectively the same as noNamespaceSchemaLocation)

methods.name: schemaLocation
methods.description: Pairs of uri references (one for the namespace name, and one for a hint as to the location of a schema document defining names for that namespace name). see doc on the method.

methods.name: schemaLocationToAdd
methods.description: pairs of uri references which will be added to the wsdl

methods.name: schemaSessionKey
methods.description: session key for retrieving a schema

methods.defaultValue: (Only used when writetoseclog=true) Comma separated list of keys of session variables that is appended to the security log record
methods.name: secLogSessionKeys
skipOnEmptyInput
methods.description: when set, the processing continues directly at the forward of this pipe, without executing the pipe itself

methods.name: soapBody
methods.description: name of the child element of the soap body. or a comma separated list of names to choose from (only one is allowed) (wsdl generator will use the first element) (use empty value to allow an empty soap body, for example to allow element x and an empty soap body use: x,)

methods.name: soapBodyNamespace
methods.description: creates schemalocation attribute based on the wsdl and replaces the namespace of the soap body element

methods.name: soapHeader
methods.description: name of the child element of the soap header. or a comma separated list of names to choose from (only one is allowed) (wsdl generator will use the first element) (use empty value to allow an empty soap header, for example to allow element x and an empty soap header use: x,)

methods.name: soapHeaderNamespace
methods.description: can be used when the soap header element exists multiple times

methods.name: soapNamespace
methods.description: The namespace of the SOAP envelope, when this property has a value and the input message is a SOAP message, the content of the SOAP Body is used for validation, hence the SOAP Envelope and SOAP Body elements are not considered part of the message to validate. Please note that this functionality is deprecated, using {@link nl.nn.adapterframework.soap.SoapValidator} is now the preferred solution in case a SOAP message needs to be validated, in other cases give this property an empty value

methods.name: soapVersion
methods.description: soap envelope xsd version to use: 1.1, 1.2 or any (both 1.1 and 1.2)

methods.name: storeResultInSessionKey
methods.description: If set, the result (before replacing when true) is stored under this session key

methods.name: strictJsonArraySyntax
methods.description: If true check that incoming json adheres to the specified syntax (compact or full), otherwise both types are accepted for conversion from json to xml

methods.name: targetNamespace
methods.description: Only for json input: namespace of the resulting xml. Need only be specified when the namespace of root name is ambiguous in the schema

methods.name: throwException
methods.description: Should the XmlValidator throw a PipeRunexception on a validation error. If not, a forward with name 'failure' must be defined.

methods.name: transactionAttribute
methods.description:
Defines transaction and isolation behaviour.For developers: it is equalto EJB transaction attribute.Possible values are:
transactionAttributecallers TransactionPipeline excecuted in Transaction
Required noneT2
T1 T1
RequiresNew noneT2
T1 T2
Mandatory noneerror
T1 T1
NotSupportednonenone
T1 none
Supports nonenone
T1 T1
Never nonenone
T1 error

methods.name: transactionAttributeNum
methods.description:
Like transactionAttribute, but the chosen option is represented with a number. The numbers mean:
0Required
1Supports
2Mandatory
3RequiresNew
4NotSupported
5Never

methods.name: transactionTimeout
methods.description: timeout (in seconds) of transaction started to process a message.

methods.name: useBaseImportedSchemaLocationsToIgnore
methods.description: If set true, the comparison for importedSchemaLocationsToIgnore is done on base filename without any path

methods.name: validateFile
methods.description: If set true, the input is assumed to be the name of the file to be validated. Otherwise the input itself is validated

methods.name: validateJsonToRootElementOnly
methods.description: If true, and converting to or from json, then the message root is the only rootValidation, ignoring root validations like for SOAP envelope and header set by descender classes like SoapValidator

methods.name: warn
methods.description: If set true, send warnings to logging and console about syntax problems in the configured schema('s)

methods.name: wsdl
methods.description: the wsdl to read the xsd's from

methods.name: xmlReasonSessionKey
methods.description: Like reasonSessionKey but stores reasons in xml format and more extensive

methods.name: xmlSchemaVersion
methods.description: If set to 1.0, Xerces's previous XML Schema factory will be used, which would make all XSD 1.1 features illegal. The default behaviour can also be set with xsd.processor.version property.

methods.name: acceptNamespaceLessXml
methods.description: If true, all xml is allowed to be without namespaces. If no namespaces are detected (by the presence of the string 'xmlns') in the xml string, the root namespace is added to the xml

methods.name: active
methods.description: controls whether pipe is included in configuration. when set false or set to something else as true, (even set to the empty string), the pipe is not included in the configuration

methods.name: addNamespaceToSchema
methods.description: If set true, the namespace from schemalocation is added to the schema document as targetnamespace

methods.name: allowPlainXml
methods.description: allow plain xml, without a SOAP Envelope, too

methods.name: autoFormat
methods.description: If true, the format on 'output' is set to the same as the format of the input message on 'input'. The format of the input message is stored in and retrieved from the session variable specified by outputFormatSessionKey

methods.name: charset
methods.description: Characterset used for reading file, only used when validateFile is true

methods.name: chompCharSize
methods.description: If set (>=0) and the character data length inside a xml element exceeds this size, the character data is chomped (with a clear comment)

methods.name: compactJsonArrays
methods.description: If true assume arrays in json do not have the element containers like in xml

methods.name: deepSearch
methods.description: If true, and converting from json to xml, parameter substitutions are searched for optional sub elements too. By default, only mandatory elements are searched for parameter substitutions. N.B. Currenlty this option might cause problems. Please try using more qualified parameters names (using '/') first

methods.defaultValue: If durationThreshold >=0 and the duration of the message processing exceeded the value specified (in milliseconds) the message is logged informatory
methods.name: durationThreshold
elementToMove
methods.description: If set, the character data in this element is stored under a session key and in the message replaced by a reference to this session key: {sessionkey: + elementToMoveSessionKey + }

methods.name: elementToMoveChain
methods.description: Like elementToMove but element is preceded with all ancestor elements and separated by semicolons (e.g. 'adapter;pipeline;pipe')

methods.defaultValue: ref_ + the name of the element
methods.name: elementToMoveSessionKey
methods.description: (Only used when elementToMove is set) Name of the session key under which the character data is stored

methods.name: emptyInputReplacement
methods.description: If set and the input is empty, this fixed value is taken as input

methods.name: failOnWildcards
methods.description: If true, an exception is thrown when a wildcard is found in the xml schema when parsing an object. This often indicates that an element is not properly typed in the xml schema, and could lead to ambuigities.

methods.name: forwardFailureToSuccess
methods.description: If set true, the failure forward is replaced by the success forward (like a warning mode)

methods.name: forwardName
methods.description: Sets the name of the forward that is looked up upon completion.

methods.name: fullSchemaChecking
methods.description: Perform addional memory intensive checks

methods.name: getInputFromFixedValue
methods.description: If set, this fixed value is taken as input, instead of regular input

methods.name: getInputFromSessionKey
methods.description: If set, input is taken from this session key, instead of regular input

methods.name: hideRegex
methods.description: Regular expression to mask strings in the log. For example, the regular expression (?<=<password>).*?(?=</password>) will replace every character between keys '<password>' and '</password>'. note: this feature is used at adapter level, so one pipe affects all pipes in the pipeline (and multiple values in different pipes are merged)

methods.name: ifParam
methods.description: when set, this pipe is only executed when the value of parameter with name ifparam equals ifvalue (otherwise this pipe is skipped)

methods.name: ifValue
methods.description: see ifparam

methods.name: ignoreCaching
methods.description: If set true, the number for caching validators in appConstants is ignored and no caching is done (for this validator only)

methods.name: importedNamespacesToIgnore
methods.description: Comma separated list of namespaces which are excluded from an import or include in the schema document

methods.name: importedSchemaLocationsToIgnore
methods.description: Comma separated list of schemaLocations which are excluded from an import or include in the schema document

methods.name: inputFormatSessionKey
methods.description: Session key to store the inputformat in, to be able to set the outputformat when autoForamat=true.

methods.name: jsonWithRootElements
methods.description: If true, assume that json contains/must contain a root element

methods.name: lazyInit
methods.description: If set, the value in appconstants is overwritten (for this validator only)

methods.name: maxThreads
methods.description: maximum number of threads that may call {@link #doPipe(java.lang.Object, nl.nn.adapterframework.core.IPipeLineSession)} simultaneously

methods.name: name
methods.description: name of the pipe

methods.name: namespaceAware
methods.description: controls namespace-awareness of possible xml parsing in descender-classes

methods.name: noNamespaceSchemaLocation
methods.description: A uri reference as a hint as to the location of a schema document with no target namespace.

methods.name: outputFormat
methods.description: Default format of the result. Either 'xml' or 'json'

methods.name: outputFormatSessionKey
methods.description: Session key to retrieve outputformat from.

methods.name: outputSoapBody
methods.description: identical to the soapbody attribute except that it's used for the output message instead of the input message. for more information see note 1

methods.name: preserveInput
methods.description: If set true, the result of the pipe is replaced with the original input (i.e. the input before configured replacements of getInputFromSessionKey, getInputFromFixedValue or emptyInputReplacement)

methods.name: produceNamespaceLessXml
methods.description: If true, all xml that is generated is without a namespace set

methods.name: reasonSessionKey
methods.description: If set: key of session variable to store reasons of mis-validation in

methods.name: responseRoot
methods.description: Name of the response root element, or a comma separated list of names to choose from (only one is allowed)

methods.defaultValue: If set true, compacted messages in the result are restored to their original format (see also {@link #setElementToMove(java.lang.String)})
methods.name: restoreMovedElements

methods.description: If set true, the number for caching validators in appConstants is ignored and no caching is done (for this validator only)

methods.name: importedNamespacesToIgnore
methods.description: Comma separated list of namespaces which are excluded from an import or include in the schema document

methods.name: importedSchemaLocationsToIgnore
methods.description: Comma separated list of schemaLocations which are excluded from an import or include in the schema document

methods.name: inputFormatSessionKey
methods.description: Session key to store the inputformat in, to be able to set the outputformat when autoForamat=true.

methods.name: jsonWithRootElements
methods.description: If true, assume that json contains/must contain a root element

methods.name: lazyInit
methods.description: If set, the value in appconstants is overwritten (for this validator only)

methods.name: maxThreads
methods.description: maximum number of threads that may call {@link #doPipe(java.lang.Object, nl.nn.adapterframework.core.IPipeLineSession)} simultaneously

methods.name: name
methods.description: name of the pipe

methods.name: namespaceAware
methods.description: controls namespace-awareness of possible xml parsing in descender-classes

methods.name: noNamespaceSchemaLocation
methods.description: A uri reference as a hint as to the location of a schema document with no target namespace.

methods.name: outputFormat
methods.description: Default format of the result. Either 'xml' or 'json'

methods.name: outputFormatSessionKey
methods.description: Session key to retrieve outputformat from.

methods.name: preserveInput
methods.description: If set true, the result of the pipe is replaced with the original input (i.e. the input before configured replacements of getInputFromSessionKey, getInputFromFixedValue or emptyInputReplacement)

methods.name: produceNamespaceLessXml
methods.description: If true, all xml that is generated is without a namespace set

methods.name: reasonSessionKey
methods.description: If set: key of session variable to store reasons of mis-validation in

methods.name: responseRoot
methods.description: Name of the response root element, or a comma separated list of names to choose from (only one is allowed)

methods.defaultValue: If set true, compacted messages in the result are restored to their original format (see also {@link #setElementToMove(java.lang.String)})
methods.name: restoreMovedElements
root
methods.description: Name of the root element, or a comma separated list of names to choose from (only one is allowed)

methods.name: rootElementSessionKey
methods.description: key of session variable to store the name of the root element

methods.name: rootNamespaceSessionKey
methods.description: key of session variable to store the namespace of the root element

methods.name: schema
methods.description: the filename of the schema on the classpath. see doc on the method. (effectively the same as noNamespaceSchemaLocation)

methods.name: schemaLocation
methods.description: Pairs of uri references (one for the namespace name, and one for a hint as to the location of a schema document defining names for that namespace name). see doc on the method.

methods.name: schemaSessionKey
methods.description: session key for retrieving a schema

methods.defaultValue: (Only used when writetoseclog=true) Comma separated list of keys of session variables that is appended to the security log record
methods.name: secLogSessionKeys
skipOnEmptyInput
methods.description: when set, the processing continues directly at the forward of this pipe, without executing the pipe itself

methods.name: soapNamespace
methods.description: The namespace of the SOAP envelope, when this property has a value and the input message is a SOAP message, the content of the SOAP Body is used for validation, hence the SOAP Envelope and SOAP Body elements are not considered part of the message to validate. Please note that this functionality is deprecated, using {@link nl.nn.adapterframework.soap.SoapValidator} is now the preferred solution in case a SOAP message needs to be validated, in other cases give this property an empty value

methods.name: storeResultInSessionKey
methods.description: If set, the result (before replacing when true) is stored under this session key

methods.name: strictJsonArraySyntax
methods.description: If true check that incoming json adheres to the specified syntax (compact or full), otherwise both types are accepted for conversion from json to xml

methods.name: targetNamespace
methods.description: Only for json input: namespace of the resulting xml. Need only be specified when the namespace of root name is ambiguous in the schema

methods.name: throwException
methods.description: Should the XmlValidator throw a PipeRunexception on a validation error. If not, a forward with name 'failure' must be defined.

methods.name: transactionAttribute
methods.description:
Defines transaction and isolation behaviour.For developers: it is equalto EJB transaction attribute.Possible values are:
transactionAttributecallers TransactionPipeline excecuted in Transaction
Required noneT2
T1 T1
RequiresNew noneT2
T1 T2
Mandatory noneerror
T1 T1
NotSupportednonenone
T1 none
Supports nonenone
T1 T1
Never nonenone
T1 error

methods.name: transactionAttributeNum
methods.description:
Like transactionAttribute, but the chosen option is represented with a number. The numbers mean:
0Required
1Supports
2Mandatory
3RequiresNew
4NotSupported
5Never

methods.name: transactionTimeout
methods.description: timeout (in seconds) of transaction started to process a message.

methods.name: useBaseImportedSchemaLocationsToIgnore
methods.description: If set true, the comparison for importedSchemaLocationsToIgnore is done on base filename without any path

methods.name: validateFile
methods.description: If set true, the input is assumed to be the name of the file to be validated. Otherwise the input itself is validated

methods.name: validateJsonToRootElementOnly
methods.description: If true, and converting to or from json, then the message root is the only rootValidation, ignoring root validations like for SOAP envelope and header set by descender classes like SoapValidator

methods.name: warn
methods.description: If set true, send warnings to logging and console about syntax problems in the configured schema('s)

methods.name: xmlReasonSessionKey
methods.description: Like reasonSessionKey but stores reasons in xml format and more extensive

methods.name: xmlSchemaVersion
methods.description: If set to 1.0, Xerces's previous XML Schema factory will be used, which would make all XSD 1.1 features illegal. The default behaviour can also be set with xsd.processor.version property.

methods.name: acceptNamespaceLessXml
methods.description: If true, all xml is allowed to be without namespaces. If no namespaces are detected (by the presence of the string 'xmlns') in the xml string, the root namespace is added to the xml

methods.name: active
methods.description: controls whether pipe is included in configuration. when set false or set to something else as true, (even set to the empty string), the pipe is not included in the configuration

methods.name: addNamespaceToSchema
methods.description: If set true, the namespace from schemalocation is added to the schema document as targetnamespace

methods.name: allowPlainXml
methods.description: allow plain xml, without a SOAP Envelope, too

methods.name: autoFormat
methods.description: If true, the format on 'output' is set to the same as the format of the input message on 'input'. The format of the input message is stored in and retrieved from the session variable specified by outputFormatSessionKey

methods.name: charset
methods.description: Characterset used for reading file, only used when validateFile is true

methods.name: chompCharSize
methods.description: If set (>=0) and the character data length inside a xml element exceeds this size, the character data is chomped (with a clear comment)

methods.name: compactJsonArrays
methods.description: If true assume arrays in json do not have the element containers like in xml

methods.name: deepSearch
methods.description: If true, and converting from json to xml, parameter substitutions are searched for optional sub elements too. By default, only mandatory elements are searched for parameter substitutions. N.B. Currenlty this option might cause problems. Please try using more qualified parameters names (using '/') first

methods.defaultValue: If durationThreshold >=0 and the duration of the message processing exceeded the value specified (in milliseconds) the message is logged informatory
methods.name: durationThreshold
elementToMove
methods.description: If set, the character data in this element is stored under a session key and in the message replaced by a reference to this session key: {sessionkey: + elementToMoveSessionKey + }

methods.name: elementToMoveChain
methods.description: Like elementToMove but element is preceded with all ancestor elements and separated by semicolons (e.g. 'adapter;pipeline;pipe')

methods.defaultValue: ref_ + the name of the element
methods.name: elementToMoveSessionKey
methods.description: (Only used when elementToMove is set) Name of the session key under which the character data is stored

methods.name: emptyInputReplacement
methods.description: If set and the input is empty, this fixed value is taken as input

methods.name: failOnWildcards
methods.description: If true, an exception is thrown when a wildcard is found in the xml schema when parsing an object. This often indicates that an element is not properly typed in the xml schema, and could lead to ambuigities.

methods.name: forwardFailureToSuccess
methods.description: If set true, the failure forward is replaced by the success forward (like a warning mode)

methods.name: forwardName
methods.description: Sets the name of the forward that is looked up upon completion.

methods.name: fullSchemaChecking
methods.description: Perform addional memory intensive checks

methods.name: getInputFromFixedValue
methods.description: If set, this fixed value is taken as input, instead of regular input

methods.name: getInputFromSessionKey
methods.description: If set, input is taken from this session key, instead of regular input

methods.name: hideRegex
methods.description: Regular expression to mask strings in the log. For example, the regular expression (?<=<password>).*?(?=</password>) will replace every character between keys '<password>' and '</password>'. note: this feature is used at adapter level, so one pipe affects all pipes in the pipeline (and multiple values in different pipes are merged)

methods.name: ifParam
methods.description: when set, this pipe is only executed when the value of parameter with name ifparam equals ifvalue (otherwise this pipe is skipped)

methods.description: see ifparam

methods.description: If set true, the number for caching validators in appConstants is ignored and no caching is done (for this validator only)

methods.description: when set, this pipe is only executed when the value of parameter with name ifparam equals ifvalue (otherwise this pipe is skipped)

methods.name: ifValue
methods.description: see ifparam

methods.name: ignoreCaching
methods.description: If set true, the number for caching validators in appConstants is ignored and no caching is done (for this validator only)

methods.name: importedNamespacesToIgnore
methods.description: Comma separated list of namespaces which are excluded from an import or include in the schema document

methods.name: importedSchemaLocationsToIgnore
methods.description: Comma separated list of schemaLocations which are excluded from an import or include in the schema document

methods.name: lazyInit
methods.description: If set, the value in appconstants is overwritten (for this validator only)

methods.name: maxThreads
methods.description: maximum number of threads that may call {@link #doPipe(java.lang.Object, nl.nn.adapterframework.core.IPipeLineSession)} simultaneously

methods.name: name
methods.description: name of the pipe

methods.name: namespaceAware
methods.description: controls namespace-awareness of possible xml parsing in descender-classes

methods.name: noNamespaceSchemaLocation
methods.description: A uri reference as a hint as to the location of a schema document with no target namespace.

methods.name: preserveInput
methods.description: If set true, the result of the pipe is replaced with the original input (i.e. the input before configured replacements of getInputFromSessionKey, getInputFromFixedValue or emptyInputReplacement)

methods.name: reasonSessionKey
methods.description: If set: key of session variable to store reasons of mis-validation in

methods.name: responseRoot
methods.description: Name of the response root element, or a comma separated list of names to choose from (only one is allowed)

methods.defaultValue: If set true, compacted messages in the result are restored to their original format (see also {@link #setElementToMove(java.lang.String)})
methods.name: restoreMovedElements
root
methods.description: Name of the root element, or a comma separated list of names to choose from (only one is allowed)

methods.name: rootElementSessionKey
methods.description: key of session variable to store the name of the root element

methods.name: rootNamespaceSessionKey
methods.description: key of session variable to store the namespace of the root element

methods.name: schema
methods.description: the filename of the schema on the classpath. see doc on the method. (effectively the same as noNamespaceSchemaLocation)

methods.name: schemaLocation
methods.description: Pairs of uri references (one for the namespace name, and one for a hint as to the location of a schema document defining names for that namespace name). see doc on the method.

methods.name: schemaSessionKey
methods.description: session key for retrieving a schema

methods.defaultValue: (Only used when writetoseclog=true) Comma separated list of keys of session variables that is appended to the security log record
methods.name: secLogSessionKeys
skipOnEmptyInput
methods.description: when set, the processing continues directly at the forward of this pipe, without executing the pipe itself

methods.name: soapNamespace
methods.description: The namespace of the SOAP envelope, when this property has a value and the input message is a SOAP message, the content of the SOAP Body is used for validation, hence the SOAP Envelope and SOAP Body elements are not considered part of the message to validate. Please note that this functionality is deprecated, using {@link nl.nn.adapterframework.soap.SoapValidator} is now the preferred solution in case a SOAP message needs to be validated, in other cases give this property an empty value

methods.name: storeResultInSessionKey
methods.description: If set, the result (before replacing when true) is stored under this session key

methods.name: throwException
methods.description: Should the XmlValidator throw a PipeRunexception on a validation error. If not, a forward with name 'failure' must be defined.

methods.name: transactionAttribute
methods.description:
Defines transaction and isolation behaviour.For developers: it is equalto EJB transaction attribute.Possible values are:
transactionAttributecallers TransactionPipeline excecuted in Transaction
Required noneT2
T1 T1
RequiresNew noneT2
T1 T2
Mandatory noneerror
T1 T1
NotSupportednonenone
T1 none
Supports nonenone
T1 T1
Never nonenone
T1 error

methods.description:
Like transactionAttribute, but the chosen option is represented with a number. The numbers mean:
0Required
1Supports
2Mandatory
3RequiresNew
4NotSupported
5Never

methods.name: transactionTimeout
methods.description: timeout (in seconds) of transaction started to process a message.

methods.name: useBaseImportedSchemaLocationsToIgnore
methods.description: If set true, the comparison for importedSchemaLocationsToIgnore is done on base filename without any path

methods.name: validateFile
methods.description: If set true, the input is assumed to be the name of the file to be validated. Otherwise the input itself is validated

methods.name: warn
methods.description: If set true, send warnings to logging and console about syntax problems in the configured schema('s)

methods.name: xmlReasonSessionKey
methods.description: Like reasonSessionKey but stores reasons in xml format and more extensive

methods.name: xmlSchemaVersion
methods.description: If set to 1.0, Xerces's previous XML Schema factory will be used, which would make all XSD 1.1 features illegal. The default behaviour can also be set with xsd.processor.version property.

methods.description: controls whether pipe is included in configuration. when set false or set to something else as true, (even set to the empty string), the pipe is not included in the configuration

methods.name: allowPlainXml
methods.description: For direction=unwrap only: if true, allow unwrapped xml too

methods.name: chompCharSize
methods.description: If set (>=0) and the character data length inside a xml element exceeds this size, the character data is chomped (with a clear comment)

methods.name: direction
methods.description: Either wrap or unwrap

methods.defaultValue: If durationThreshold >=0 and the duration of the message processing exceeded the value specified (in milliseconds) the message is logged informatory

methods.name: soapHeaderStyleSheet
methods.description: (only used when direction=wrap) Stylesheet to create the content of the soap header. As input for this stylesheet a dummy xml string is used. Note: outputtype=xml and xslt2=true

methods.name: soapNamespace
methods.description: (only used when direction=wrap) Namespace of the soap envelope

methods.name: soapNamespaceSessionKey
methods.description: Key of session variable to store auto detected soapNamespace

methods.name: soapVersion
methods.description: Soap version to use: one of soap1.1, soap1.2, none or auto. none means that no wrapping or unwrapping will be done, auto means auto-detect

methods.name: storeResultInSessionKey
methods.description: If set, the result (before replacing when true) is stored under this session key

methods.name: transactionAttribute
methods.description:
Defines transaction and isolation behaviour.For developers: it is equalto EJB transaction attribute.Possible values are:
transactionAttributecallers TransactionPipeline excecuted in Transaction
Required noneT2
T1 T1
RequiresNew noneT2
T1 T2
Mandatory noneerror
T1 T1
NotSupportednonenone
T1 none
Supports nonenone
T1 T1
Never nonenone
T1 error

methods.name: transactionAttributeNum
methods.description:
Like transactionAttribute, but the chosen option is represented with a number. The numbers mean:
0Required
1Supports
2Mandatory
3RequiresNew
4NotSupported
5Never

methods.name: transactionTimeout
methods.description: timeout (in seconds) of transaction started to process a message.

methods.name: unlessSessionKey
methods.description: Key of session variable to check if action must be executed. The wrap or unwrap action is not executed if the session variable exists

methods.name: unlessValue
methods.description: Value of session variable 'unlessSessionKey' to check if action must be executed. The wrap or unwrap action is not executed if the session variable has the specified value

methods.name: useFixedValues
methods.description: If true, the fields CorrelationId, MessageId and Timestamp will have a fixed value (for testing purposes only)

methods.name: wssAuthAlias
methods.description: alias used to obtain credentials for authentication to WebServiceSecurity

methods.name: wssPassword
methods.description: Default password for WebServiceSecurity

methods.name: wssPasswordDigest
methods.description: If true, the password is sent digested; Otherwise it is sent in clear text

methods.name: wssUserName
methods.description: Default username for WebServiceSecurity

methods.name: active
methods.description: controls whether pipe is included in configuration. when set false or set to something else as true, (even set to the empty string), the pipe is not included in the configuration

methods.name: addOutputNamespace
methods.description: (only used when direction=wrap) when true, outputNamespace is automatically set using the parameters (if $messagingLayer='P2P' then 'http://nn.nl/XSD/$businessDomain/$applicationName/$applicationFunction' else is serviceContext is not empty 'http://nn.nl/XSD/$businessDomain/$serviceName/$serviceContext/$serviceContextVersion/$operationName/$operationVersion' else 'http://nn.nl/XSD/$businessDomain/$serviceName/$serviceVersion/$operationName/$operationVersion')

methods.name: allowPlainXml
methods.description: For direction=unwrap only: if true, allow unwrapped xml too

methods.name: chompCharSize
methods.description: If set (>=0) and the character data length inside a xml element exceeds this size, the character data is chomped (with a clear comment)

methods.name: cmhVersion
methods.description: (only used when mode=reg) Common Message Header version (1 or 2)

methods.name: direction
methods.description: Either wrap or unwrap

methods.defaultValue: If durationThreshold >=0 and the duration of the message processing exceeded the value specified (in milliseconds) the message is logged informatory
methods.name: durationThreshold
elementToMove
methods.description: If set, the character data in this element is stored under a session key and in the message replaced by a reference to this session key: {sessionkey: + elementToMoveSessionKey + }

methods.name: elementToMoveChain
methods.description: Like elementToMove but element is preceded with all ancestor elements and separated by semicolons (e.g. 'adapter;pipeline;pipe')

methods.defaultValue: ref_ + the name of the element
methods.name: elementToMoveSessionKey
methods.description: (Only used when elementToMove is set) Name of the session key under which the character data is stored

methods.name: emptyInputReplacement
methods.description: If set and the input is empty, this fixed value is taken as input

methods.name: encodingStyle
methods.description: The encodingstyle to be set in the soap header

methods.name: esbAlias
methods.description: When the messagingLayer part of the destination has this value interpret it as ESB

methods.name: fixResultNamespace
methods.description: (only used when direction=wrap) when true and the Result tag already exists, the namespace is changed

methods.name: forwardName
methods.description: Sets the name of the forward that is looked up upon completion.

methods.name: getInputFromFixedValue
methods.description: If set, this fixed value is taken as input, instead of regular input

methods.name: getInputFromSessionKey
methods.description: If set, input is taken from this session key, instead of regular input

methods.name: hideRegex
methods.description: Regular expression to mask strings in the log. For example, the regular expression (?<=<password>).*?(?=</password>) will replace every character between keys '<password>' and '</password>'. note: this feature is used at adapter level, so one pipe affects all pipes in the pipeline (and multiple values in different pipes are merged)

methods.name: ifParam
methods.description: when set, this pipe is only executed when the value of parameter with name ifparam equals ifvalue (otherwise this pipe is skipped)

methods.name: ifValue
methods.description: see ifparam

methods.name: ignoreSoapFault
methods.description: (only used when direction=unwrap) If false and the soap body contains a soap fault, a PipeRunException is thrown

methods.name: maxThreads
methods.description: maximum number of threads that may call {@link #doPipe(java.lang.Object, nl.nn.adapterframework.core.IPipeLineSession)} simultaneously

methods.name: mode
methods.description: either i2t (ifsa2tibco), reg (regular) or bis (Business Integration Services)

methods.name: name
methods.description: name of the pipe

methods.name: namespaceAware
methods.description: controls namespace-awareness of possible xml parsing in descender-classes

methods.name: onlyIfSessionKey
methods.description: Key of session variable to check if action must be executed. The wrap or unwrap action is only executed if the session variable exists

methods.name: onlyIfValue
methods.description: Value of session variable 'onlyIfSessionKey' to check if action must be executed. The wrap or unwrap action is only executed if the session variable has the specified value

methods.name: outputNamespace
methods.description: (only used when direction=wrap) If not empty, this namespace is added to the root element in the soap body

methods.name: p2pAlias
methods.description: When the messagingLayer part of the destination has this value interpret it as P2P

methods.name: preserveInput
methods.description: If set true, the result of the pipe is replaced with the original input (i.e. the input before configured replacements of getInputFromSessionKey, getInputFromFixedValue or emptyInputReplacement)

methods.name: removeOutputNamespaces
methods.description: (only used when direction=unwrap) If true, namespaces (and prefixes) in the content of the soap body are removed

methods.name: removeUnusedOutputNamespaces
methods.description: (only used when direction=unwrap and removeoutputnamespaces=false) If true, unused namespaces in the content of the soap body are removed

methods.defaultValue: If set true, compacted messages in the result are restored to their original format (see also {@link #setElementToMove(java.lang.String)})
methods.name: restoreMovedElements
retrievePhysicalDestination
methods.description: (only used when direction=wrap) when true, the physical destination is retrieved from the queue instead of using the parameter destination

methods.name: root
methods.description: If not empty, the root element in the soap body is changed to this value

methods.defaultValue: (Only used when writetoseclog=true) Comma separated list of keys of session variables that is appended to the security log record
methods.name: secLogSessionKeys
serviceNamespace
methods.description: The default for the namespace of the message sent. Identifies the service to be called. May be overriden by an actual namespace setting in the message to be sent

methods.name: skipOnEmptyInput
methods.description: when set, the processing continues directly at the forward of this pipe, without executing the pipe itself

methods.name: soapBodyStyleSheet
methods.description: (only used when direction=wrap) Stylesheet to apply to the input message. Note: outputtype=xml and xslt2=true

methods.name: soapHeaderSessionKey
methods.description: Key of session variable to store soap header

methods.name: soapHeaderStyleSheet
methods.description: (only used when direction=wrap) Stylesheet to create the content of the soap header. As input for this stylesheet a dummy xml string is used. Note: outputtype=xml and xslt2=true

methods.name: soapNamespace
methods.description: (only used when direction=wrap) Namespace of the soap envelope

methods.name: soapNamespaceSessionKey
methods.description: Key of session variable to store auto detected soapNamespace

methods.name: soapVersion
methods.description: Soap version to use: one of soap1.1, soap1.2, none or auto. none means that no wrapping or unwrapping will be done, auto means auto-detect

methods.name: storeResultInSessionKey
methods.description: If set, the result (before replacing when true) is stored under this session key

methods.description: Key of session variable to store soap header

methods.name: soapHeaderStyleSheet
methods.description: (only used when direction=wrap) Stylesheet to create the content of the soap header. As input for this stylesheet a dummy xml string is used. Note: outputtype=xml and xslt2=true

methods.name: soapNamespace
methods.description: (only used when direction=wrap) Namespace of the soap envelope

methods.name: soapNamespaceSessionKey
methods.description: Key of session variable to store auto detected soapNamespace

methods.name: soapVersion
methods.description: Soap version to use: one of soap1.1, soap1.2, none or auto. none means that no wrapping or unwrapping will be done, auto means auto-detect

methods.name: storeResultInSessionKey
methods.description: If set, the result (before replacing when true) is stored under this session key

methods.name: transactionAttribute
methods.description:
Defines transaction and isolation behaviour.For developers: it is equalto EJB transaction attribute.Possible values are:
transactionAttributecallers TransactionPipeline excecuted in Transaction
Required noneT2
T1 T1
RequiresNew noneT2
T1 T2
Mandatory noneerror
T1 T1
NotSupportednonenone
T1 none
Supports nonenone
T1 T1
Never nonenone
T1 error

methods.name: transactionAttributeNum
methods.description:
Like transactionAttribute, but the chosen option is represented with a number. The numbers mean:
0Required
1Supports
2Mandatory
3RequiresNew
4NotSupported
5Never

methods.name: transactionTimeout
methods.description: timeout (in seconds) of transaction started to process a message.

methods.name: unlessSessionKey
methods.description: Key of session variable to check if action must be executed. The wrap or unwrap action is not executed if the session variable exists

methods.name: unlessValue
methods.description: Value of session variable 'unlessSessionKey' to check if action must be executed. The wrap or unwrap action is not executed if the session variable has the specified value

methods.name: wssAuthAlias
methods.description: alias used to obtain credentials for authentication to WebServiceSecurity

methods.name: wssPassword
methods.description: Default password for WebServiceSecurity

methods.name: wssPasswordDigest
methods.description: If true, the password is sent digested; Otherwise it is sent in clear text

methods.name: wssUserName
methods.description: Default username for WebServiceSecurity

methods.name: active
methods.description: controls whether pipe is included in configuration. when set false or set to something else as true, (even set to the empty string), the pipe is not included in the configuration

methods.name: chompCharSize
methods.description: If set (>=0) and the character data length inside a xml element exceeds this size, the character data is chomped (with a clear comment)

methods.defaultValue: If durationThreshold >=0 and the duration of the message processing exceeded the value specified (in milliseconds) the message is logged informatory
methods.name: durationThreshold
elementToMove
methods.description: If set, the character data in this element is stored under a session key and in the message replaced by a reference to this session key: {sessionkey: + elementToMoveSessionKey + }

methods.name: elementToMoveChain
methods.description: Like elementToMove but element is preceded with all ancestor elements and separated by semicolons (e.g. 'adapter;pipeline;pipe')

methods.defaultValue: ref_ + the name of the element
methods.name: elementToMoveSessionKey
methods.description: (Only used when elementToMove is set) Name of the session key under which the character data is stored

methods.name: emptyInputReplacement
methods.description: If set and the input is empty, this fixed value is taken as input

methods.name: forwardName
methods.description: Sets the name of the forward that is looked up upon completion.

methods.name: getInputFromFixedValue
methods.description: If set, this fixed value is taken as input, instead of regular input

methods.name: getInputFromSessionKey
methods.description: If set, input is taken from this session key, instead of regular input

methods.name: hideRegex
methods.description: Regular expression to mask strings in the log. For example, the regular expression (?<=<password>).*?(?=</password>) will replace every character between keys '<password>' and '</password>'. note: this feature is used at adapter level, so one pipe affects all pipes in the pipeline (and multiple values in different pipes are merged)

methods.name: ifParam
methods.description: when set, this pipe is only executed when the value of parameter with name ifparam equals ifvalue (otherwise this pipe is skipped)

methods.name: ifValue
methods.description: see ifparam

methods.name: maxThreads
methods.description: maximum number of threads that may call {@link #doPipe(java.lang.Object, nl.nn.adapterframework.core.IPipeLineSession)} simultaneously

methods.name: name
methods.description: name of the pipe

methods.name: namespaceAware
methods.description: controls namespace-awareness of possible xml parsing in descender-classes

methods.name: preserveInput
methods.description: If set true, the result of the pipe is replaced with the original input (i.e. the input before configured replacements of getInputFromSessionKey, getInputFromFixedValue or emptyInputReplacement)

methods.defaultValue: If set true, compacted messages in the result are restored to their original format (see also {@link #setElementToMove(java.lang.String)})
methods.name: restoreMovedElements

methods.defaultValue: (Only used when writetoseclog=true) Comma separated list of keys of session variables that is appended to the security log record
methods.name: secLogSessionKeys
skipOnEmptyInput
methods.description: when set, the processing continues directly at the forward of this pipe, without executing the pipe itself

methods.name: storeResultInSessionKey
methods.description: If set, the result (before replacing when true) is stored under this session key

methods.name: throwException
methods.description: when true, a piperunexception is thrown. otherwise the output is only logged as an error (and returned in a xml string with 'error' tags)

methods.name: timeout
methods.description: timeout in seconds of obtaining a result

methods.name: transactionTimeout
methods.description: timeout (in seconds) of transaction started to process a message.

methods.name: unlessSessionKey
methods.description: Key of session variable to check if action must be executed. The wrap or unwrap action is not executed if the session variable exists

methods.name: unlessValue
methods.description: Value of session variable 'unlessSessionKey' to check if action must be executed. The wrap or unwrap action is not executed if the session variable has the specified value

methods.name: wssAuthAlias
methods.description: alias used to obtain credentials for authentication to WebServiceSecurity

methods.name: active
methods.description: controls whether adapter is included in configuration. when set false or set to something else as true, (even set to the empty string), the receiver is not included in the configuration

methods.name: autoStart
methods.description: controls whether adapters starts when configuration loads

methods.name: description
methods.description: description of the adapter

methods.name: messageKeeperSize

methods.name: msgLogHidden
methods.description: if set to true, the length of the message is shown in the msg log instead of the content of the message

methods.name: msgLogLevel
methods.description:
defines behaviour for logging messages. Configuration is done in the MSG appender in log4j4ibis.properties. Possible values are:
msgLogLevelmessages which are logged
Off No logging
BasicLogs information from adapter level messages
TerseLogs information from pipe messages.
All Logs all messages.

methods.name: name
methods.description: name of the adapter

methods.name: replaceNullMessage

methods.description: controls whether empty keys are used for caching. when set true, cache entries with empty keys can exist.

methods.name: cacheEmptyValues
methods.description: controls whether empty values will be cached. when set true, empty cache entries can exist for any key.

methods.name: diskExpiryThreadIntervalSeconds
methods.description: How often to run the disk store expiry thread

methods.name: diskPersistent
methods.description: If true, the the cache is reloaded after the JVM restarts

methods.name: eternal
methods.description: If true, the elements in the cache are eternal, i.e. never expire

methods.name: keyInputSessionKey

methods.description: stylesheet to extract cache key from request message. Use in combination with {@link #setCacheEmptyKeys(boolean) cacheEmptyKeys} to inhibit caching for certain groups of request messages

methods.name: keyXPathOutputType

methods.name: maxElementsOnDisk
methods.description: The maximum number of elements on disk, before they are removed

methods.name: memoryStoreEvictionPolicy
methods.description: Either LRU=Least Recent Use,LFU=Least Frequent Use or FIFO=First In - First Out

methods.name: name
methods.description: name of the cache, will be set from owner

methods.name: overflowToDisk
methods.description: If true, the elements that are evicted from memory are spooled to disk

methods.name: timeToIdleSeconds
methods.description: The amount of time to live for an element from its last accessed or modified date

methods.name: timeToLiveSeconds
methods.description: The amount of time to live for an element from its creation date

methods.description: session key to use as input for transformation of response message to cached value by valuexpath or valuestylesheet

methods.name: valueNamespaceDefs

methods.name: valueXPath
methods.description: xpath expression to extract value to be cached key from response message. Use in combination with {@link #setCacheEmptyValues(boolean) cacheEmptyValues} to inhibit caching for certain groups of response messages

methods.name: deleteEmptySubdirectories

methods.description: the exit state defines possible exists to the pipeline. the state can be one of the following: success, error

methods.description: repeat the job at the specified number of ms. keep cronexpression empty to use interval. set to 0 to only run once at startup of the application. a value of 0 in combination with function 'sendmessage' will set dependencytimeout on the ibislocalsender to -1 the keep waiting indefinitely instead of max 60 seconds for the adapter to start.

methods.name: name

methods.name: transactionAttribute
methods.description:
The transactionAttribute declares transactional behavior of job execution. It applies both to database transactions and XA transactions. In general, a transactionAttribute is used to start a new transaction or suspend the current one when required. For developers: it is equal to EJB transaction attribute. Possible values for transactionAttribute:

Mandatory noneerror
T1 T1
NotSupportednonenone
T1 none
Supports nonenone
T1 T1
Never nonenone
T1 error

methods.name: authAlias
methods.description: Authentication alias used to authenticate when connecting to database

methods.name: authentication
methods.description: maps to the field context.security_authentication

methods.name: credentials
methods.description: username to connect to context, maps to context.security_credentials

methods.name: datasourceName
methods.description: JNDI name of datasource to be used, can be configured via jmsRealm, too

methods.name: dateFormatSuffix
methods.description: format for date which is added after objectid (e.g. yyyymmdd to be sure the job is executed only once a day)

methods.name: firstDelay
methods.description: the time in ms to wait before the first attempt to acquire a lock is made, this may be 0 but keep in mind that the other thread or ibis instance will propably not get much change to acquire a lock when another message is already waiting for the thread having the current lock in which case it will probably acquire a new lock soon after releasing the current lock

methods.name: initialContextFactoryName
methods.description: class to use as initial context factory

methods.name: jndiAuthAlias
methods.description: authentication alias, may be used to override principal and credential-settings

methods.name: name
methods.description: Name of the sender

methods.name: numRetries
methods.description: the number of times an attempt should be made to acquire a lock, after this many times an exception is thrown when no lock could be acquired, when -1 the number of retries is unlimited

methods.name: objectId
methods.description: identifier for this lock

methods.name: password
methods.description: Password for authentication when connecting to database, when none found from authAlias

methods.name: principal
methods.description: username to connect to context, maps to context.security_principal

methods.name: retention
methods.description: the time (for type=p in days and for type=t in hours) to keep the record in the database before making it eligible for deletion by a cleanup process

methods.name: retryDelay
methods.description: the time in ms to wait before another attempt to acquire a lock is made

methods.name: securityProtocol
methods.description: maps to the field context.security_protocol

methods.name: type
methods.description: type for this lock: p(ermanent) or t(emporary). a temporary lock is deleted after the job has completed

methods.name: urlPkgPrefixes
methods.description: maps to the field context.url_pkg_prefixes

methods.name: username
methods.description: User name for authentication when connecting to database, when none found from authAlias

methods.name: authAlias
methods.description: Alias used to obtain username and password, used when a pattern containing {username} or {password} is specified

methods.name: decimalSeparator
methods.description: Used in combination with type number

methods.name: defaultValue
methods.description: If the result of sessionKey, xpathExpression and/or stylesheet returns null or an empty string, this value is returned

methods.name: defaultValueMethods
methods.description: Comma separated list of methods (defaultvalue, sessionKey, pattern, value or input) to use as default value. Used in the order they appear until a non-null value is found.

methods.name: formatString
methods.description: Used in combination with types date, time and datetime

methods.name: groupingSeparator
methods.description: Used in combination with type number

methods.name: hidden
methods.description: If set to true, the value of the parameter will not be shown in the log (replaced by asterisks)

methods.name: maxInclusive
methods.description: Used in combination with type number; if set and the value of the parameter exceeds this maximum value, this maximum value is taken

methods.name: maxLength
methods.description: If set (>=0) and the length of the value of the parameter exceeds this maximum length, the length is trimmed to this maximum length

methods.name: minInclusive
methods.description: Used in combination with type number; if set and the value of the parameter exceeds this minimum value, this minimum value is taken

methods.name: minLength
methods.description: If set (>=0) and the length of the value of the parameter deceeds this minimum length, the value is padded

methods.name: name
methods.description: Name of the parameter

methods.name: namespaceDefs
methods.description: Namespace defintions for xpathExpression. Must be in the form of a comma or space separated list of prefix=namespaceuri-definitions. One entry can be without a prefix, that will define the default namespace.

methods.name: password
methods.description: Default password that is used when a pattern containing {password} is specified

methods.name: pattern
methods.description:
Value of parameter is determined using substitution and formating. The expression can contain references to session-variables or other parameters using {name-of-parameter} and is formatted using java.text.MessageFormat.
If for instance fname is a parameter or session variable that resolves to eric, then the pattern 'hi {fname}, hoe gaat het?' resolves to 'hi eric, hoe gaat het?'.
The following predefined reference can be used in the expression too:
  • {now}: the current system time
  • {uid}: an unique identifier, based on the IP address and java.rmi.server.UID
  • {uuid}: an unique identifier, based on the IP address and java.util.UUID
  • {hostname}: the name of the machine the application runs on
  • {username}: username from the credentials found using authAlias, or the username attribute
  • {password}: password from the credentials found using authAlias, or the password attribute
  • {fixeddate}: fake date, for testing only
  • {fixeduid}: fake uid, for testing only
  • {fixedhostname}: fake hostname, for testing only
A guid can be generated using {hostname}_{uid}, see also http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.4.2/docs/api/java/rmi/server/uid.html for more information about (g)uid's or http://docs.oracle.com/javase/1.5.0/docs/api/java/util/uuid.html for more information about uuid's.

methods.name: removeNamespaces
methods.description: When set true namespaces (and prefixes) in the input message are removed before the stylesheet/xpathexpression is executed

methods.name: sessionKey
methods.description:
Key of a pipelinesession-variable.
If specified, the value of the pipelinesession variable is used as input for the xpathExpression or stylesheet, instead of the current input message.
If no xpathExpression or stylesheet are specified, the value itself is returned.
If the value '*' is specified, all existing sessionkeys are added as parameter of which the name starts with the name of this parameter.
If also the name of the parameter has the value '*' then all existing sessionkeys are added as parameter (except tsreceived)

methods.name: sessionKeyXPath
methods.description: Instead of a fixed sessionkey it's also possible to use a xpath expression to extract the name of the sessionkey

methods.name: styleSheetName
methods.description: url to a stylesheet that wil be applied to the contents of the message or the value of the session-variable.

methods.name: type
methods.description:
• string: renders the contents of the first node (in combination with xslt or xpath).
    Please note that if there are child nodes, only the contents are returned, use xml if the xml tags are required
  • xml: renders an xml-nodeset as an xml-string (in combination with xslt or xpath). This will include the xml tags
  • node: renders the CONTENTS of the first node as a nodeset that can be used as such when passed as xslt-parameter (only for XSLT 1.0).
    Please note that the nodeset may contain multiple nodes, without a common root node.
    N.B. The result is the set of children of what you might expect it to be...
  • domdoc: renders xml as a DOM document; similar to node with the distinction that there is always a common root node (required for XSLT 2.0)
  • date: converts the result to a Date, by default using formatString yyyy-MM-dd. When applied as a JDBC parameter, the method setDate() is used
  • time: converts the result to a Date, by default using formatString HH:mm:ss. When applied as a JDBC parameter, the method setTime() is used
  • datetime: converts the result to a Date, by default using formatString yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss. When applied as a JDBC parameter, the method setTimestamp() is used
  • timestamp: similar to datetime, except for the formatString that is yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.SSS by default
  • xmldatetime: converts the result from a XML dateTime to a Date. When applied as a JDBC parameter, the method setTimestamp() is used
  • number: converts the result to a Number, using decimalSeparator and groupingSeparator. When applied as a JDBC parameter, the method setDouble() is used
  • integer: converts the result to an Integer
  • inputstream: only applicable as a JDBC parameter, the method setBinaryStream() is used
  • list: converts a List<String> object to a xml-string (<items><item>...</item><item>...</item></items>)
  • map: converts a Map<String, String> object to a xml-string (<items><item name='...'>...</item><item name='...'>...</item></items>)

methods.name: userName
methods.description: Default username that is used when a pattern containing {username} is specified

methods.name: value
methods.description: The value of the parameter, or the base for transformation using xpathExpression or stylesheet, or formatting.

methods.name: xpathExpression
methods.description: the xpath expression to extract the parameter value from the (xml formatted) input or session-variable.

methods.description: when set false or set to something else as true, (even set to the empty string), the receiver is not included in the configuration

methods.description: If set to true, each message is checked for presence in the message log. If already present, it is not processed again. Only required for non XA compatible messaging. Requires messagelog!

methods.name: checkForDuplicatesMethod
methods.description: (Only used when checkForDuplicates=true) Either 'CORRELATIONID' or 'MESSAGEID'. Indicates whether the messageid or the correlationid is used for checking presence in the message log

methods.name: chompCharSize
methods.description: If set (>=0) and the character data length inside a xml element exceeds this size, the character data is chomped (with a clear comment)

methods.description: Namespace defintions for correlationIDXPath. Must be in the form of a comma or space separated list of prefix=namespaceuri-definitions

methods.name: correlationIDXPath
methods.description: XPath expression to extract correlationid from message

methods.name: elementToMove
methods.description: If set, the character data in this element is stored under a session key and in the message replaced by a reference to this session key: {sessionkey: + elementtomovesessionkey + }

methods.description: Like elementtomove but element is preceded with all ancestor elements and separated by semicolons (e.g. adapter;pipeline;pipe)

methods.defaultValue: ref_ + the name of the element

methods.description: (Only used when elementtomove is set) Name of the session key under which the character data is stored

methods.name: hiddenInputSessionKeys
methods.description: comma separated list of keys of session variables which are available when the pipelinesession is created and of which the value will not be shown in the log (replaced by asterisks)

methods.name: hideMethod
methods.description: (Only used when hideRegex is not empty) either all or firstHalf. When firstHalf only the first half of the string is masked, otherwise (all) the entire string is masked

methods.name: hideRegex
methods.description: Regular expression to mask strings in the errorStore/logStore. Every character between to the strings in this expression will be replaced by a '*'. For example, the regular expression (?<=<party>).*?(?=</party>) will replace every character between keys<party> and </party>

methods.name: labelNamespaceDefs
methods.description: Namespace defintions for labelXPath. Must be in the form of a comma or space separated list of prefix=namespaceuri-definitions

methods.name: labelStyleSheet
methods.description: Stylesheet to extract label from message

methods.name: labelXPath
methods.description: XPath expression to extract label from message

methods.name: maxDeliveries
methods.description: the maximum delivery count after which to stop processing the message. when -1 the delivery count is ignored

methods.name: maxRetries
methods.description: the number of times a processing attempt is retried after an exception is caught or rollback is experienced (only applicable for transacted receivers). if maxretries < 0 the number of attempts is infinite

methods.name: name

methods.name: numThreads

methods.description: the number of threads that are activily polling for messages concurrently. '0' means 'limited only by numthreads' (only for pulling listeners)

methods.name: onError
methods.description: one of 'continue' or 'close'. controls the behaviour of the receiver when it encounters an error sending a reply or receives an exception asynchronously

methods.name: pollInterval
methods.description: The number of seconds waited after an unsuccesful poll attempt before another poll attempt is made. Only for polling listeners, not for e.g. ifsa, jms, webservice or javaListeners

methods.name: returnedSessionKeys
